loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en: Fortunato is supervising the renovation of his home. He requested a loan for 47,000 PHP, which she use to provide his house with a good roof.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 29-years-old single and an educated man, living with his family in Hodeidah city, Yemen. Due to the miserable condition of his family, Mohammed couldn't complete his studies. In reality, Mohammed is very active and dynamic young man and depends on himself. 

In order to improve the living condition of his family, Mohammed decided to work as a driver on his friend's motorcycle. He has started in that business for six months. He realized this business is very profitable for him. Mohammed decided to purchase that motorcycle from his friend to drive it and all the profits will be for himself. 

Through that short time, Mohammed could accumulate an amount of money. Unfortunately, that accumulated money is not enough to purchase a motorcycle. For this reason, Mohammed applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a motorcycle for himself to drive to transport people from one area to another to earn money. That will help him in improve the living condition of his family.

Mohammed looks forward to purchasing a bus to drive to help him in improve the living condition of his family more. He plans to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for himself  to transport people from one area to another

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 15 years. She earns additional income from selling frozen food. 

Marifel requested her eighth loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marisol has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Marisol has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marisol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 54 years old, married, and has five children two of whom attend school. She operates a pig fattening business in the Philippines. which she has been doing for ten years.

Myrna requested her fifteenth loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ten

texts.en:
Ten is a 51-year-old widowed woman with three children. She has been a farmer since 1979. All of her children are garment-factory workers. They live in Kmapong Speu Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $15 (USD) per day. 

Now Ten would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children commuting from home to work. This loan will help her to reduce her children’s travelling expenses. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children commuting from home to work

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Ky is 42 years old, a farmer and a married woman with three children. She has been a farmer since 1993. Her husband who is 44 years old, is a construction foreman. One of her children is a garment-factory worker, one is a construction worker, and another is a student. All of them live in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $22.16 (USD) per day. 

Now Ky would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughter commuting from home to work at the garment factory. This loan will help her daughter reduce her travelling expense. In the future, she is going to renovate her house and support her youngest child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter commuting from home to work

loans.name: Pele

texts.en: Pele is a 22-year-old single man with no children. He makes and sells ice cakes in his community to earn a living. He has one year of experience with this business. Pele needs a loan to buy sugar, a deep freezer, foam cups, Chinese candy and a large cooler. He plans to use his profits to pay for his family's weekly expenses. Pele has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy sugar, a deep freezer, foam cups, Chinese candy, and a large cooler

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 50 years old and married with five children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Malia needs a loan to buy a new watering hose, chemicals, new boots, overalls, and new gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Malia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new watering hose, chemicals, new boots, overalls, and new gloves

loans.name: Fualaau

texts.en:
Fualaau is a 26-year-old single woman with two children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Fualaau needs a loan to buy drinks, pies, cakes, snacks, soft drinks, paper plates, and cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Fualaau has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy drinks, pies, cakes, snacks, soft drinks, paper plates, and cups

loans.name: Liua

texts.en:
Liua is a 23-year-old, single woman, with no children. To earn a living, she makes and sells pancakes in her community. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Liua needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

Liua has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Virgilio is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of his home. He hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, supported by his loan of PHP 7,000. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record, a matter that Virgilio has given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what he is thankful for when all his financing needs for his retail business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to do house renovation

loans.name: Yiedah

texts.en:
Yiedah works hard to support her family. Yiedah is widowed and has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Yiedah requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Yiedah has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Yiedah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 58 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felisa has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Felisa requested a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional materials for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Cionela

texts.en:
Cionela is 40 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cionela sells native bags in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Cionela requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more native bags to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase native bags to sell

loans.name: Babylonia

texts.en:
Babylonia is 59 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Babylonia works very hard to provide for them.

Babylonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Babylonia has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, etc. 

Babylonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 64 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. 

Prima requested her thirteenth loan from NWTF for 23,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional livestock, feeds, and other supplies for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Ma. Lolita is 52 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Lolita has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Al- Emtiaz Group

texts.en:
Al-Emtiaz is a group which consists of four women, living in Taiz city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Emtiaz is the leader of the group. She is a 29-year-old married woman with two children, living with her family in their own house in a humble area. Emtiaz has a diploma certificate. She lives with her family in a very  small and old house. It needs to have a renovation and an expansion. 

Unfortunately, Emtiaz's husband doesn’t have a fixed income and it is not enough to make that renovation. Emtiaz strives strongly to make her family live in a better condition and a comfortable house. She decided to help her husband through sharing with him all the responsibilities of the family. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron, steel, and other materials to renovate and expand the house.

Emtiaz looks forward to finishing all the renovation and expanding of the house. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron, steel, and other materials to renovate and expand the house.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.  Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ada Isamara

texts.es: Ada es una mujer de 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, dos hijas y dos sobrinos. Ada se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace mucho tienda y es así como junto a sus esposo mantiene la economía de su hogar y llevan el sustento diario. Ada desea construir un cuarto a base de ladrillo para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y para pagar la mano de obra necesaria para la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en:
Ada is a 31 year old woman who lives in her own home with her husband, two daughters and two nieces and nephews. Ada has run a store for a long time which has allowed her and her husband to maintain the household costs and provide food daily. 

Ada would like to build a room out of bricks which is why she has made the decision to apply for a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand and gravel and pay for the cost of labour needed to build the room.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and gravel and pay for the cost of labour needed to build a room

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her fishing business. In the future, Eulalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her fishing business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native bags making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business. Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Samatar Group

texts.en:
Khader is 32 years old and lives in Hargeisa City, Somaliland. He is married and has two children who have not yet reached school age.

He runs a retail shop as his second source of income and he works at Somaliland Ministry of Education where he earns his other income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. 

He is the leader of a group Known as Samatar which consists 6 members, 4 Male and 2 Female members.  All the group members have have pre-existing, various businesses and they all need to expand their medium and small business. Khader is the one raising his hand at the middle of the group photo.

He has requested a loan from Kaaba Microfinance Institution to buy more general merchandise like sugar, rice, bottled water, soda drinks,etc. to sell.

loans.use: to expand his retail shop

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with three children. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, cereals, snack foods, juice, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, snack foods, juice, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, cereals, snack foods, juice, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в Каменке. Этот бизнес начал еще 21 год назад. На данный момент уже имеет 8 больших теплиц под отоплением. Выращивает в основном помидоры и огурцы. Три года назад Александр выгружал бревна для отопления теплиц и ему бревно сломало ногу. Уже возраст, нога долго не сросталась, почти 2 года пользовался костылями. Трудно было работать, приходилось все время кого-то нанимать даже для того, чтобы выполнять элементарную работу. Сейчас все срослось, но старается ногу сильно не нагружать. 
На сумму в 40 000 гривен планирует приобрести удобрения, пленку, семена на весну, а также сделать ремонт одной из теплиц, которая должна быть готова к следующему сезону. Со временем нужно будет огородить участок, поставить хороший забор, а затем уже заняться и ремонтом дома. Александр также думает, что нужно будет переделывать отопление, так как газовое может быть теперь невыгодно.
texts.en:
Alexander grows vegetables on his own plot of land in Kamenka. He started this business 21 years ago. Her currently has 8 large greenhouses with heating systems. He primarily grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Three years ago, Alexander was unloading lumber for his greenhouse heating systems when one of the lumber beams broke his leg. As he was already an older man, it took his leg a long time to heal. He used crutches for almost two years. It was difficult for him to work so he had to hire someone to accomplish even basic tasks for his business. Now everything is healed, but he tries not to put a lot of weight on his leg.

With the 40,000 hryvnia (UAH), he plans to buy fertilizer, plastic covering and seeds for Spring. He also wants to make repairs to one of his greenhouses, which needs to be ready for the next planting season. Eventually, he needs to delineate his plot of land, put up a good fence and then he can make repairs to his house. Alexander also thinks that he needs to renovate his heating system, as a gas-based system could now be uneconomical.

loans.use: to purchase plastic covering, seeds and fertilizer and to fix one of his greenhouses.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Vilma from Cabagan. She is married with children. She runs a fish selling business located in the market where this photo was taken. The business has been in operation for six and a half years. She says the main challenge faced in the her business is of stiff competition.

Vilma has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fish for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her welfare, hence helping her to purchase a motor vehicle. 

In the future, Vilma plans to open a grocery store so that she have additional income  and she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 49 years old and married. She is a  mother to four children. Wilma has had her own business selling drinks, fruits and vegetables with her sister.  She began to work in this sector out of necessity. She wakes up every day at 4 a.m. to go out to purchase what she needs to sell in the market.

She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as laundry detergent, soap and other products that her clients want to buy. This way she will have more income, and will improve the quality of life for herself and for her children.

Wilma's dream is to have a bigger stall, to have everything that her clients look for and to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as laundry detergent, soap and other products that her clients want to buy.

loans.name: Princess Joyce

texts.en:
Princess Joyce is 23 years old. She went to school up to high school. She is married and has one kid.

She has had a store for a year. She learned the business through her husband, who has experience in sales, and her store is in her house. She will invest the loan in improving her store. It will improve her life because she will have more income from the store.

Her plans for the future are for her store to grow, to attract more customers, and to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, candies, spices and beverages

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a widow and she works hard to support her family. She has a salt-making business in the Philippines.

Jelly is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy empty sacks for her salt for her salt-making business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva loans. Jelly hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy empty sacks for her salt-making.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is 31 years old and married with one child. He earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Freddie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional cattle and other supplies for his business.

Freddie has been raising cattle for three years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. He is working tirelessly towards the attainment of his dream: to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle and other supplies for his business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Vincent Fred is 17 years old and is 3rd of the three children in the family.  His mother Susana a member of NWTF, supports the family through her furniture making business in the Philippines.

Vincent Fred is studying a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a major in Financial Management and is currently in the first of this 4-year course.

Susana, Vincent Fred's mother is borrowing PHP 12000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When he graduates, Vincent Fred plans to find job and help her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Connie is 32 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a buy-and-sell native bags business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more native bags to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Connie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more native bags to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 56 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is still in school.

Julieta is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 10500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming bananas for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old and is married with three children. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap detergent, shampoo, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. 

Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soap detergent, shampoo, fabric conditioner, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Fretzie

texts.en:
Christian Jay is 18 years old and is first of the four children in the family. His mother Fretzie a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Christian Jay is studying for a  Bachelor of Science in Business Administration degree with a major in Financial Management and is currently in the 3rd of this 4-year course.

Fretzie, Christian Jay's mother is borrowing PHP 5000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Christian Jay plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza works hard to support her family. Glaiza is married and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Glaiza requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

She has been in this business for 8 years now.

Glaiza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Liezel

texts.en:
Ma. Liezel is 41 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are currently in school.  Ma. Liezel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Liezel has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kasen

texts.en:
This is the story of Sartika, the daughter of Kasen:  

I am the older child in my family.  Here, I want to ask Kiva for help.  I really want to keep on studying, but it’s hard for my parents to fund my education.  My father is a farm worker with an uncertain income.  That makes it harder to meet our daily needs.  Meanwhile, my parents still have to take care of my younger sibling.  My mother takes care of the house and the kids so she can’t help much either.  It’s been hard for me watching them work hard everyday.  I want to keep on studying but I don’t want to make my parents' burden heavier.  That’s why, I hope by joining Kiva, I can find my way out. In the picture, Kasen, Tarsilem his wife and his daughter Sartika.

loans.use: to pay for the education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Eliseta

texts.en:
Eliseta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of shoes to sell for her business buying and selling used shoes.

Eliseta has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from a general store.

Eliseta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of shoes to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites owns and operates a market stall store to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her room for rent and transportation service.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. She will also use a portion of the loan for the maintenance of her transportation unit and rooms for rent.

In the future, Marites wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 32 year old mother of one, settled for a living in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband works with her in making nipa hut to sell. For over three years in the business, they have loyal costumers who make purchases. It helps a lot to sustain their needs. 

To increase numbers of stock, Josephine took a loan from GDMPC to buy additional raw materials for nipa hut making. In the future, she plans to sell their woven nipa hut in the neighboring villages to have more return for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for nipa hut making

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a resident of Intramuros Manila, Philippines. She is 23 years old, and she is happily married to Rommel, who is a driver. God has blessed them with children and all of them are still studying. Life, indeed, is hard. But by the grace of God, the couple are helping each other in raising their children and in working for the family.

Maricris owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg and others items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Aside from this, she also manages their own coffee shop while at the same time operating a videoke machine, which helps with their everyday expenses. Her regular customers are her neighbours, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, Maricris is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Maricris desires that her business will become bigger and that she will have more customers within her community. She dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married with 11 children. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Gloria is a farmer and grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. For this cropping season, she has requested a loan to buy four sacks of rice.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Gloria hopes to harvest more to continuosly provide basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to pay for four sacks of rice.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Cristina  has been in this business for 6 years. Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Analey

texts.en:
Analey is 38 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She has a live-in partner.

Analey is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Analey requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analey would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 56 years old, married and has eight children, one of whom is still in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Avelina has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Avelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Charminda

texts.en:
Charminda is 29 years old and single.

Charminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, beer, coffee, detergent soap, cereals and other groceries to sell.

Charminda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer, coffee, detergent soap, cereals and other groceries.

In the future, Charminda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, beer, coffee, detergent soap, cereals and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia is 51 years old and married with one child, who is in school.  Elia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Elia has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Elia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Rubén Eliseo

texts.es:
Rubén de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, tenía que madrugar a las 5:00 a.m. para poder llegar hasta su destino, ahora está acompañado y su pareja administra una tienda, tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela y el otro no porque tiene 6 meses de nacido.

Rubén se dedica a comercializar hamacas de seda desde hace dos años, a la vez realiza trabajos de electricista desde  hace 15 años, pero no solo eso, porque además se dedica a la agricultura y construcción de viveros, todas estas actividades las aprendió de sus padres y hoy en día le sirven de mucho para sacar adelante a su familia.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar hilo de seda para tejer hamacas, además necesita comprar más productos de la canasta básica para la tienda que administra su pareja.

Rubén sueña con que su negocio de hamacas crezca, apoyar a sus hijos en todo y que la tienda sea rentable.
texts.en:
Rubén is 33 years old and he studied until high school. He had to get up at 5:00 am to be able to get to his destination. Now he is married, and his wife manages a store. He has two children, one of them is in school and the other is not, because he is only six months old.

Rubén has made a living making silk hammocks for the past two years. At the same time, he has worked as an electrician for the past fifteen years, but not only that, because in addition he works as a farmer as well as building greenhouses. He learned all of these jobs from his parents, and he currently uses these skills to support his family. 

He requires the loan to buy silk thread to knit hammocks, as well as to buy more staple items for the store his wife manages.

Rubén dreams that his hammock business will grow and that the store will be profitable, to fully support his children.

loans.use: to buy silk thread to knit hammocks, as well as to buy more staple items for the store his wife manages.

loans.name: Norberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Norberto, un hombre de 55 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en unión libre con su esposa y es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales siempre ha educado y ha protegido con todos los medios que tiene a su alcance.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos, gallinas y huevos, tiene sus animales albergados en un galpón al lado de su casa y es con esta actividad que ha intentado sobrevivir con su familia durante varios años.

Pide un apoyo económico para realizar mantenimiento y mejoras a su galpón, adicionalmente comprara pollos de engorde y gallinas para aumentar su capital y mejorar su producción.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más rentable y sostenible, permitiendo sacar a su familia adelante y llenar su vida con esperanzas.
texts.en:
Norberto is 55 years old and full of dreams and aspirations in life. He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and is the father of 3 children who he has always educated and protected with every resource within his reach.

He currently earns a living by producing and selling chicks, hens, and eggs. He keeps his chickens in a shed next to his house. It is through this business that he has tried to survive with his family for several years.

He is requesting financial support to do maintenance and make improvements to his chicken shed. Also, he will buy chickens for fattening and some hens so he can increase his capital and improve his production.

With this loan he will be able to have a more profitable and sustainable business that will allow him to provide for his family and fill his life with hope.

loans.use: to do maintenance and make improvements to his chicken shed and also buy chickens for fattening and some hens.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of used shoes to sell for her business buying and selling used shoes.

Jessica has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is a agriculture and she is started to selling vegetables in 2011 with her own working capital of $30.00. Now she is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is selling vegetables because she is is earning a good income from it. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business and she is taking the loan to buy more manure, vegetable seeds and other materials. She lives near the road, so many people come to buy her vegetables. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin because with it she can increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy manure, vegetable seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en: Bendita lives in Ermera, she is married and she is a business woman. She has a kiosk in her house. She is requesting a loan of $700 to improve her kiosk. She is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy needed items to keep in her kiosk such as biscuits, candies, cooking oils, noodles, sardines, soft drinks and other thing to sell. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $200. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin, because with it she can improve her management in the future. She has animals in her house like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, candies, cooking oils,noodles,sardines and other thing to sell incluiding soft drinks .

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado ya que su padre los abandonó y vivía solo con su madre por lo tanto tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ahora está casado y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad que estudia en el kinder.

José trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace seis años, trabaja como promotor social apoyando el deporte infantil y de jóvenes de la comunidad, su horario es de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM y los fines  de semana trabaja en la agricultura, pues siembra maíz y frijol para el sostén de la familia.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar abono para aplicar a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, además pagará mano de obra y el alquiler del terreno donde va a sembrar.

Él sueña con apoyar a su hijo en los estudios para que tenga oportunidad de superarse profesionalmente y además le gustaría construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old.  He only attended school until sixth grade because his father abandoned him and he lived alone with his mother so he had to work in order to help with the household expenses.  He is now married and has a six-year-old son who is in kindergarten.  José has worked in the municipal government for the past six years.  He works as a social promotor, supporting community youth athletics.  His schedule is from 8am to 4pm and on the weekends, he works in agriculture planting corn and beans to sustain his family.

He is in need of this loan to purchase fertilizers to apply to his corn and bean crops.  He will also use it to pay for labor and to pay the rent on the land where he will plant his crops.  He dreams of supporting his son in his education so that he will have opportunities to succeed professionally, and he would also like to build his own home.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer to apply to his corn and bean crops, as well as to pay for labor and the rent for the land where he will plant his crops.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 57 years old and married with fourteen children. With two children still in school, Bebiana works very hard to provide for them.

Bebiana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sanitary pads, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods and other groceries to sell.

Bebiana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Bebiana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sanitary pads, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Consorcia requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Consorcia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old, married and has with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elena has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elena has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: perform maintenance on her fryer and the cooking utensils that she uses to prepare her food.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 44 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from coconut farming and abaca weaving.

Merlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana es una madre de un pequeño hijo de ya 5 años de edad y por el cual ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerlo y brindarle todo lo que necesita.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el aseo personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su hijo.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un vitrina para exhibir sus productos, también comprara surtido de productos como cremas de manos, desodorantes, lociones, enjugues, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana has a small five year old son.  She has worked tirelessly in order to support him and to provide him with everything that he needs.

She found the way to generate good income being close to her son.  It is selling merchandise like personal care items.

She is now starting with a very small amount of capital.  She is in the stage of acquiring customers.  That is the reason that she is requesting a loan to buy a display case to show her products.  She will also buy wholesale a stock of products like hand creams, deodorants, lotions, and rinses, among others.  This way she will stock her small business with quality products.

With the help of the loan she will be able to drive her business forward.  She will have a better variety of products to sell.  This way she will manage to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy a display case and a stock of products like hand creams, deodorants, lotions, and rinses.

loans.name: Odeakye Ye Group

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children, the oldest is 18 years and the youngest, 6 years old. All her children are currently attending school. 

Mary is a peasant farmer who grows cassava, maize, yams, sweet potatoes, and produces palm oil.  She lives with her family at Gold Coast Camp in the Central Region of Ghana. Mary's main source of income is through the palm oil processing which she uses to support her husband to take care of the family. 

Mary is a member of Odeakye Ye Group. The entire group has decided to use the Elsa clean cook stove.  Mary's main problem is that she can't get the total amount to buy the Elsa clean cook stove at hand to replace her open mud firewood stove.  Mary is very anxious to buy a clean stove to reduce indoor air pollution and to save the lives of her family. Besides, she will save the money she now uses in buying firewood because she can get the fuel for the clean stove (virgin pellet) from her oil processing.  

Together with her group members, she is very happy because using the clean stove will protect her family and community at large. Mary is grateful to her micro-lenders for their unfailing support. Your micro-loan means reducing child- and maternal-mortality, and illnesses.

loans.use: to purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 23 years old, with one child who is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Penny

texts.en:
Penny works hard to support her family.  She is married and has sells used shoes in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional used shoes to sell.

Penny  has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Penny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional used shoes to sell

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia  junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 niñas de 6 y 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como jornalero desde hace 15 años, además su compañera de vida lo apoya económicamente y entre los dos van sacando adelante a sus hijas, gracias a sus trabajos. Roberto habita en ese terreno desde hace 31 años pero cuando su primer hijo nació construyo su humilde vivienda de adobe, a la cual necesita  cambiar el techo deteriorado ya que ha necesitado colocar plástico para proteger sus pertenencias de la lluvia, además desea encementar el piso del corredor de la misma, que como se observa en la fotografía actualmente es de tierra, Por lo anterior Roberto solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y grava para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Roberto, 31 years old, lives with his life partner and their 2 daughters, ages 6 and 2. He is a hardworking man who has worked as a day laborer for 15 years. His life partner helps him financially, and thanks to their work, the two are able to support their daughters. Roberto has lived on this property for 31 years, but when their first child was born he built his humble adobe home, whose deteriorated roof needs to be changed; he has had to cover it in plastic to protect his belongings from the rain. He also wants to cement the floor of the hallway of the house, which, as can be seen in the photo, is made of dirt. Therefore, Roberto is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to replace the roof and cement the floor of the hallway in his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to replace the roof and cement the floor of the hallway in his house.

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie is 53 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lelanie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lelanie has been farming rice for 25 years and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43, married and has seven children, four of whom are still in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, etc. for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing nets, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Gemma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Gemma has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Yarleny

texts.es:
Yarleny es un joven muy emprendedora luchadora y perseguidora de sus sueños, no se deja influenciar siempre persigue sus metas y a pesar de su juventud quiere proyectarse y mejorar la calidad de vida pues tiene una pequeña inspiración de 3 años de edad por la cual se levanta cada día con una sonrisa para luchar y pelear por un futuro digno para ella. 

Yarleny tiene un Kiosco donde vende productos como bebidas, cereza, bebidas alcohólicas, dulces y “Mekatos” que son antojos en envolturas como galletas, papas etc. 
Yarley es Técnica en venta de productos y servicios y aplicando sus conocimientos ve la posibilidad de diversificar su oferta al cliente, esperando tener una mejor aceptación y acreditación del negocio por lo que pide un crédito para la compra de productos básicamente abarrotes y granos mejorando su oferta la publico. 

Sueña con seguir creciendo, estudiar la profesionalización y seguir un camino como independiente, tener salud para ver a su hija crecer y que su negocio sea prospero para comprar todos los artilugios que no pudo tener.
texts.en:
Yarleny is a young woman who is enterprising, strives and follows her dreams.  She does not allow herself to be influenced, and always chases after her goals and regardless of her youth, she wants to progress and improve her quality of life because she has a small, three year old source of inspiration for whom she wakes up every morning with a smile so that she can strive and fight for a better future for her.  

Yarleny has a kiosk where she sells products such as beverages, beer, alcoholic beverages, candy,  "Mekatos", which are packaged snacks such as cookies, potato chips, etc.  Yarleny is experienced in product and services sales, and by applying her knowledge, she see the potential to diversify her offering to her customers. 

She hopes to increase the acceptance and reputation of her business, which is why she is asking for a loan to purchase groceries and grains so that she can improve the merchandise that she offers to the public.  She dreams of continuing her growth, studying for a profession, continuing on her personal path, be healthy enough to see her daughter grow, and for her business to prosper so that she can have all of the things she was never able to have.

loans.use: purchase groceries and grains to diversify her offerings so that she can attract and retain new customers.  These products would be rice, brown sugar, oil, chocolate and pastas.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José es un joven de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado y ahora está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, tiene un niño de 7 años que vive con ellos y está estudiando, por lo tanto son 2 personas las que dependen de José.


Actualmente, José se dedica a la reparación de llantas de motocicletas y vehículos, tiene dos años de dedicarse a este oficio y lo aprendió por medio de un hermano, pero anteriormente trabajó en una panadería.
 La reparación de llantas lo hace en su casa, no tiene un horario de trabajo específico y en ocasiones su pareja es quien se involucra.


Este crédito lo necesita para pagar una deuda que tiene en una institución financiera.


Los sueños de José son darle todo lo necesario a su hijo para que  no viva las carencias que él vivió, ademas desea tener el negocio de llantas mas surtido para mejorar sus ingresos económicos, él sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y los prestamos lo hará posible.
texts.en:
José, age 25, went to school through the seventh grade.  He is now in a relationship, and his life partner devotes herself to the household chores.  He has a seven year old son who lives with them and goes to school.  Therefore, there are two people who are dependent upon José.

José currently works repairing tires for motorcycles and other vehicles.  He has been engaged in this trade for two years.  He learned from a brother.  He previously worked in a bakery.

He repairs the tires at his house.  He does not have a specific work schedule.  At times, his life partner is involved in the business.

He needs this loan to repay a debt that he has with a financial institution.

José’s dream is to give his son everything he needs so that he does not have to live with the deprivations that José did.  He also wishes to have his tire business better stocked in order to improve his income.  He knows that with God’s help and the loan, it will be possible.

loans.use: to repay a debt that he has with a financial institution.

loans.name: Maura Dolores

texts.es: Maura tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y su hija de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida por medio de la venta de fruta y antojitos típicos dentro de su comunidad. Maura solicita nuevamente un crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la  construcción de una cocina para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, lámina y pagar mano de obra para la construcción. Expresa estar muy agradecida dado que con el préstamo anterior logró construir un  cuarto dormitorio
texts.en: Maura is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her parents and her 6-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, for a long time, has earned her living through the sale of fruit and typical snacks in her community. Maura is again asking a loan from FUSIA to invest in the construction of a kitchen, for which she needs materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and sheeting, and to pay for manual labor for the construction. She expresses much gratitude because with the previous loan she was able to build a bedroom.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and sheeting, and pay for manual labor, to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase chairs, tables, supplies and ingredients to open her restaurant that she has been planning for a long time.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Amalia is 51 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Amalia has a native bags-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Amalia has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Rutchie

texts.en:
Rutchie is 34 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rutchie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Rutchie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rutchie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 11 años de edad. María se gana la vida por medio de la elaboración y venta de pan dulce y pan francés. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea construir un cuarto dormitorio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava, ladrillo, teja y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and lives in a home that she owns with her husband and their 11-year-old daughter.  María earns a living by making and selling sweet bread and french bread.  Through this she is able to provide for her household.  

María wishes to build a bedroom for which she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase sand, cement, gravel, bricks, shingles and iron.  She hopes to be able to receive this funding so that she can start the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement, gravel, bricks, shingles and iron to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 52 years old and married with four children.

Rita works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a general store for 11 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF  to purchase groceries to sell.  She has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rita plans to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa  is 36 years old and married with two children.

Marissa  works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a general store for 4 years and requests 12,000 lPHP through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.  She has previously received funds through Kiva.

Marissa  plans to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 58 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 4 years and requests  22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries,  to sell.

Glenda has previously borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF. She earns an income from food vending.

Glenda plans to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products from catalogs, including clothing, perfume, cooking utensils, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and potato and carrot seeds in order to start his farming business and reach his dream of being independent.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is 37 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is a businesswoman and is requesting a loan of 800 USD to improve her business. She has a kiosk and will purchase additional items with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin including shoes, bags, plates, cooking oil, biscuits and other items including soft drinks to sell. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with a working capital of 500 USD. She has taken the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her income and expand her business in the future. She has animals in her house such as cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, plates, cooking oil, biscuits and other items including soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has worked at private firm since 2007. His wife is an account manager at a bank. Their children go to high school. 

He requests 400,0000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house. He hasn't renovated his house since his family moved into it. As winter is coming soon, it is necessary to renovate and insulate his house. After renovation, his house will no longer lose heat and the family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is 46 years old, and has two children. He is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell with the help of laborers also. He sends his children to school and aims for a better harvest to sustain all their needs. Now, Marlon is asking for additional revolving capital of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help improve crop production so it will produce a productive harvest someday. He will save additional revenue to sustain an education for his children.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Rhina Graciela

texts.es: Rhina de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su buen desempeño ha logrado mantener su pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad en el gusto de sus clientes, desde hace 5 años, y es por esa visión de ir buscando más productos para mantener a su clientela, que ella desea surtir más su mercadería aunque carece de financiamiento para lograrlo. Por lo anterior Rhina ha acudido a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertir en: sachets de champú, jabón, golosinas, arroz, azúcar, café, bebidas frías, etc.
texts.en: Rhina, age 42, lives in her own home with her husband and 10-year-old child. She is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her hard work, has been able to maintain her little store where she sells basic staples that her clients like. She has had this business for five years. With the vision of getting more products to maintain her clientele, she wants to stock more merchandise, but she doesn't have the funds to do so. In order to do this, Rhina has come to FUSAI to request a loan to invest in shampoo, soap, candy, rice, sugar, coffee, cold drinks, etc.

loans.use: to invest in shampoo, soap, candy, rice, sugar, coffee, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Eleonor works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Eleonor is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of items such as canned goods, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items such as canned goods, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 30 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Babylyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Babylyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Maites

texts.en:
Maites is 37 years old and married with four children.

She has earned a living raising pigs for 6 years. Maites requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She earns additional income operating a general store and restaurant.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests an additional loan to further build her business.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is  to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Morina

texts.en:
Ma. Morina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials and for the maintenance of her fishing business.  Ma. Morina has been in this business for five years.  She also earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Ma. Morina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has has a  dried fish retail business for 6 years. She earns additional income selling vegetables.

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Elma has  sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
Maria, de 41 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a cumplir sus sueños para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea iniciar con un negocio de venta de ropa en el municipio de Marinilla que gracias a la ayuda de su hermana, aprendió del negocio y se animo a iniciar con su propio proyecto.

Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus hijos, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta su hermana de poder ofrecer su mercancía en su local.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Maria, age 41, knows very clearly what she wants in life. She is set on reaching her goals, getting ahead, and having a good life.
She wants to start a business selling clothing int he Marinilla municipality. Thanks to her sister's help, she learned this business, and she is very motivated to start her own project.
She wants to start this business in order to earn the necessary income to support herself and her children. She also wants to be able to contribute to the household costs.
She is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.
She is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of a large stock of clothing in order to take advantage of the opportunity that her sister has provided to sell in her store.
She hopes to be able to grow as a businesswoman and to have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale in order to start her own business.

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Naranbaatar is 37 years old and lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has provided taxi service to local people for nine years. His brothers have graduated from university and one of them has already secured a job, the other brother is looking for a job. 

Naranbaatar requests 400,0000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, shingles and foam to renovate his home. After the renovation, his family will live in comfort and warmth and use less coal and help to lower the pollutants released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Yoselin

texts.es: Yoselin tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres tres hijos. Ella se gana la vida trabajando en un chalet del centro escolar cercano a su localidad. Es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a sus hijos lo necesario. Yoselin  solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un baño para lo cual comprará materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, hierro, lámina, tubos y pagará la mano de obra para la construcción. Ella es clienta de la Fundación dado que en el pasado fue sujeta de crédito y expresa estar muy agradecida ya que gracias al apoyo recibido logro construir un cuarto dormitorio.
texts.en: Yoselin is 31 and a single mother. She lives in her own home with her three children. She makes a living working in a store in a local school centre. This is how she provides for her children. Yoselin is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to build a bathroom. She will buy materials such as bricks, cement, iron, laminate, and tubes, and she will pay the labourers for construction. She is a client of the Fundacion because in the past she took out a loan. She says she is very grateful because, thanks to this support, she was able to build a bedroom.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, iron, laminate, and tubes, and to pay the labourers to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe is a 57-year-old  farmer living at Solana with his wife and some of his 7 children. 

He plants and harvests rice to sell. He also pays laborers who help him work the farm. He hopes to improve his crop production but has insufficient funds.  He asks for 10,000 PHP to buy six bags of fertilizer. He is already an experienced farmer who wants to  improve his harvest and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of fertilizer.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store business.

Viola has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Viola has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase paints, wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints, wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for three years. Rowena earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell young coconut business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling charcoal. Letecia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more young coconuts to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more young coconuts to sell

loans.name: Elenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elenia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Elenia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Elenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dyala

texts.es:
Dyala
Puntarenas

Dyala tiene 41 años de edad, es jefa de hogar, madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y una menor, dos de ellos estudian, su hija menor recibe una beca ya que está en primaria. Dada la difícil situación económica y a que vive separada de su esposo: hace 10 años inicia con el comercio de mercadería. Se presenta como una mujer trabajadora y sus referencias indican que cumple con sus obligaciones y tiene un buen nivel de ventas.

 Inicia con un préstamo brindado por una hermana, con los ingresos adicionales complementa sus gastos del hogar  ya que vive en un apartamento prestado.

El dinero generado por el negocio le permite tener una ganancia para reinvertir y apoyar la economía familiar. Lo complementa planchando y lavando ajeno, además de una beca que recibe su hija, y su otro hijo estudia en el Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje ( institución estatal de capacitación técnica). El financiamiento le va a permitir capital para negociar a un mejor precio su producto, obteniendo mayor ingreso y por ende aportar más a su micro negocio.

Está madre de 3 hijos quien lucha por sacarlos adelante y ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida. Trabaja en casa para obtener mayores ingresos, tiene experiencia en la actividad y buenas referencias de sus proveedores, trabaja con márgenes de ganancia que puede mejorar contando con un mayor capital de trabajo. Lleva un registro de sus ingresos y gastos además de un control de su cartera de crédito.
texts.en:
Dyala, 41, is the head of household and mother of three children, two adults and a minor, two of which are in school.  Her youngest daughter is in primary school and has a scholarship.  Due to her difficult economic situation, having divorced her husband, ten years ago she established a business selling merchandise.  She claims to be a hard-working woman and her references claim she meets her obligations and has a good level of sales.

She started out with a loan from her sister and, with additional income, she covers her household expenses and lives in an apartment that is on loan.  The money generated by her business allows her to use her profits to reinvest while supporting the family economy.  She also takes in ironing and laundry and receives a scholarship for her daughter.  Her other son attends the National Learning Institute (state institution for technical training).  

The loan will allow her to negotiate a better price on her product and give her more income for her small business.  

This mother of three struggles to provide for her family and offer them better living conditions.  She works at home to make more income, has experience in the sector and good references from her suppliers.  She works with profit margins that she can improve with more work capital.  She uses an accounting register and also controls her credit account.

loans.use: To by steel jewelry.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en: Berta is married and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $400. She has a kiosk in her house, so now she is requesting a loan of $600, and she taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management in the future. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies such as noodles, shampoo, sardines, candies, salt, detergent, cigarettes, rice, soft drinks and other things to sell. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, shampoo, sardines, candies, salt, detergent, cigarettes, rice, soft drinks and other things to sell.
