loans.name: Alex Antonio

texts.es:
Alex, a sus 33 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. Ser independiente, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a su hogar donde convive con sus padres.

Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, comenzó a comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector. 

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará calzado al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en estas temporadas, pues cuenta con la ventaja de vivir en un barrio donde hay mucha afluencia de potenciales clientes; esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Alex manifiesta que ningún obstáculo le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Alex, at 33 years of age, is a charismatic, active and accommodating man. Independence was his main reason for tirelessly struggling, day to day, seeking alternatives in earning a living and supporting his household where he lives with his parents.

Approximately 2 years ago, he began to sell very good quality shoes at excellent prices for all types of customers, which allowed him to become known in the industry.

This drives him to request the support of a loan to enhance his inventory since he will buy shoes wholesale. In this way he will be able to satisfy the demand that increases during this season. He has the advantage of living in a neighborhood where there is a high influx of potential customers. This will help him to improve the income he earns for his work.

Alex states that no obstacle impedes him from continuing to do what he is passionate about. For this he always proposes new goals and among them is one to become a large shoe distributor and generate employment opportunities. He will be able to improve his family’s quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes wholesale to sell and be able to improve his sales and inventory.

loans.name: Elia

texts.en: Elia is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of secondhand clothes. She started to do this business in 2013 with her own working capital of $340. Elia is earning a good income from selling her secondhand clothes because many people like to buy them and they are cheap and unique when compared to new clothes. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she will use it to buy more secondhand clothes such as T-shirts, long-sleeved and short-sleeved shirts and other things to sell. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, long-sleeved and short-sleeved shirts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Evelin Carolina

texts.es: Evelin de 18 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo quesadillas de arroz, dicha venta la realiza 3 días por semana desde hace 5 años y la realiza en su municipio y los lugares cercanos, además los días restantes vende hortalizas de forma ambulante, obteniendo un ingreso extra. Evelin está necesitando en su vivienda donde recoger agua, por lo que desea construir una pila, además desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Evelin, of 18 years of age, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her 2 year old son. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living selling sweet, rice bread [quesadilla de arroz]. She has carried out these sales 3 days per week for 5 years and she does this in her city and places nearby. Additionally, she sells vegetables in the streets on the remaining days, acquiring extra income. Evelin needs a place to collect water in her home which is why she wants to build a water basin. Addtionally, she wants to cement the floor of her home which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a water basin and to cement the floor of her home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a water basin and to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her eatery.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 59 years old, and he is a farmer in their village. He is very diligent in going to the rice field to visit his farm and ensures a good growth of crops. While busy on the farm, his wife also raises hogs and sells them upon achieving the desired weight. Wilson hopes to continuously develop his crop production and know he needs it for additional sustenance. So he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs in farming. He hopes to continue ensuring a good growth of crops so he can save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nilda has been farming rice for 5 years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 58 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Zenaida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 63 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Mila has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is 55 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Nelia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo and groceries.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is a 26-year-old married woman who lives in Oecusse with 3 children. She also has  pigs and dogs.

She started a retail business in 2013 with her own working capital of $ 400.00. She has a kiosk and asks for $600.00 USD to improve her business. She requests a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy  sugar, cooking oil, candies, milk, biscuits, shampoo and soft drinks. 

She will use the loan to improve her management skills.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, candies, milk, biscuits, shampoo and  soft drinks.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, who is a 41-year-old married man, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has five married children, and he also has one dependent child who is currently in school. He is an active and honest farmer who can make the income of around USD 4 per day. So far, he has been a farmer for ten years.  

Kunthea wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Vandy

texts.en:
Vandy, who is a 3-year-old married man, lives in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has only one dependent child who is currently in school. He is an active and honest farmer who can make the income of around USD 6.00 per day. So far, he has been a farmer for four years. 
 
Vandy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marites is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from selling vegetables and from rice retailing. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristine Joy works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Cristine Joy successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Cristine Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, 59 years old, is married and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past year, she has run a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns an income from farming rice. Melinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as soap, shampoo, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell.

Melinda has previously borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as soap, shampoo, eggs, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. 

Luzviminda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn, 45 years old, lives in a community in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is married and has four dependent children. Horn is an active and honest farmer who earns an income of approximately US $3 per day. He has been farming for one year.  

Horn wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine because there isn't one in his house now. He is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine to help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Horn is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. 

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Josephine is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials like gasoline and fishing nets for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like gasoline and fishing nets

loans.name: Egna

texts.en:
Egna is 60 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming trees, in the Philippines. Egna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers.

Egna has been farming trees for six years now and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fertilizers.

Irene has been farming rice  for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fertilizers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Josefina is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business. 
NWTF is re-listing Josefina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 spools of thread for making hammocks, as well as fertilizer for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 56 years old, is widowed, and has two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost two years and earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on her daily expenses. She also sells vegetables for additional income. 

Due to lack of capital for her business, Merlita wants to take out a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, candies, chips, diapers, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, candies, chips, diapers, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is, Rita, who is 45 years old and married, with four children. Rita has been engaged in fish selling for three years and seven months. She is a very loving mother. She makes sure that she can meet all the needs of her family. 

Rita is asking a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional fish for her business so that she can earn additional income. Rita dreams that someday through her business she will see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her business

loans.name: Presca

texts.en: Presca, 37 years old, is a very loving woman and the mother of three children. She is from the village of Annafunan. She loves to cook food, especially rice cakes. Her products are known in the community. Her clients have asked her to cook more rice cakes so that they can offer them for sale in other communities. For this reason, Presca is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy cake rice, sugar, coconut and vegetable oil for her business. She hopes that she can build her own shop in front of her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy cake rice, sugar, coconut and vegetable oil for her business

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (banana plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from fish vending. Isidra is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Isidra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 30 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy dry goods to sell in her business.

Genalyn has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell dry-goods business for nine years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dry goods to sell in her business

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es:
Ángela una mujer de 59 años de edad que quiere iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía de la marca Amway que serían productos de uso doméstico como lo son productos de aseo limpiadores, detergentes, jabones, y productos como cosméticos para las mujeres hermosas que habitan en Medellín.
Este negocio lo quiere iniciar como proyecto propio pues es difícil saber que tienes 59 años de edad y la gente te comience a ver como un estorbo según manifestaciones de Ángela quiere sentirse útil demostrar que puede trabajar y generar ingresos para ayudar en su casa y comprarse sus cosas, que le den arrebatos de tener algo y que pueda comprarlo. 
Sueña con ser muy exitosa escalar como vendedora en la empresa y poder realizar modificaciones a la casa hacerla más hermosa con comidades y que pueda tener una vida tranquila y cómoda.
texts.en:
Angela is 59 years old. She wants to start her own business selling Amway brand consumer products, including household cleaners, detergents, soaps, as well as cosmetics for the beautiful women of Medellin.  

She wants to start this as her own project because it is difficult to realize, she shares,  that at 59 years of age, others may begin to look at one as a nuisance. She says that she wants to feel useful. She wants to prove that she can work and generate income to help at home, and to buy her own things  when she feels like shopping. 

She dreams of success inside the enterprise and of climbing the sales ladder, of improving the comfort and beauty of her home, and of living a peaceful, comfortable life.

loans.use: to begin selling cosmetics and household goods with the objective of feeling useful to her family and feeling good about herself.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with five children.

Josephine earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.

Josephine is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

Josefina has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending and a general store. Josefina is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her abaca weaving business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Estefani Lorena

texts.es: Estefani, tiene 20 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en la universidad, su carrera tiene un periodo de 5 años viene estudiando 3 años. Ella trabaja de auxiliar contable, haciendo sus prácticas pre-profesionales, se dedica cuatro  horas para realizar sus estudios y se siente contenta y a la vez muy satisfecha de estar logrando uno de sus más anhelados sueños de convertirse en una profesional. Su sueño más grande es poder terminar su carrera satisfactoriamente por eso que le pone mucho empeño y ganas de superación,  es por ello que solicitó el préstamo para el pago de sus matricula y pensiones de sus estudios y así la joven poder desarrollarse tranquilamente. Su sueño es poder culminar sus estudios y ponerse a trabajar para abrir su propio estudio contable.
texts.en:
Estefani  is 20 years old and is currently studying for a degree in accounting at the University. Her program takes five years, and she has been studying for three years.  She works as an accounting assistant, doing her pre-professional practicum.
 She devotes four hours to study, and feels happy and at the same time very satisfied to be succeeding in one of her most wished-for dreams, that of becoming a professional. Her greatest dream is to be able to successfully complete her degree.  That is why she puts into it a great deal of effort and desire to succeed. That is why she requested the loan in order to pay for her school tuition and fees.  This way the young woman can develop herself with peace of mind. 

Her dream is to be able to complete her studies and start to work toward opening her own accounting practice.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Blanca Idalia

texts.es: Blanca de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias al esfuerzo que pone cada día está sacando adelante a sus dos hijos ella sola, y es gracias a ello que tiene más de 10 años prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, lo que le ha permitido apoyar a su hijo mayor para que estudie. Blanca desea reparar la cocina de su vivienda ya que el techo se encuentra deteriorado y el piso por ser de tierra se está hundiendo por las lluvias, es por ello que quiere cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de la cocina por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina, madera y clavos para encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de su cocina.
texts.en: Blanca, 27 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own home with her 2 children of 11 and 5 years of age. She is a woman who, thanks to the effort she puts in every day, is moving her two children ahead, by herself. For this, she has been selling her household domestic services for 10 years which has allowed her to support her eldest child’s studies. Blanca wants to repair the kitchen in her home since the roof has deteriorated and the floor, being soil, is sinking due to the rain which is why she wants to change the roof and cement the kitchen floor. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, wood and nails to cement the floor and to change the roof on her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, wood and nails to cement the floor and to change the roof on her kitchen.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a recycled materials business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of recycled materials for resale.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of recycled materials for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Letecia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Letecia successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  buy additional vegetables such as squash, onions, garlic, carrots, okra, etc. to sell for her business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables such as squash, onions, garlic, carrots, okra, etc. to sell

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn, 27 years old, is married and has two children, one of them currently in school. Judelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Judelyn has been pig fattening for 3 years and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Judelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Volodya

texts.ru:
Володя уже прибегал к финансовой помощи КИВА. Со времени пользования последней суммой, полученной от КИВА он установил большой котел для отопления теплиц, и теперь еще 3 большие теплицы у него отапливаются. Это позволило Володе смело садить два урожая — ранней весной и осенью, не боясь заморозков. Также это способствовало значительному увеличению дохода клиента. Сейчас у Володи старший сын служит пограничником на границе с Россией в районе Мариуполя. Там ведутся военные действия и Володя очень за него переживает. Остальные дети пока живут с ним и женой. 
На сумму в 40 000 гривен Володя планирует закупить необходимое для будущего сезона, а именно, пленку на 6 000 гривен, семена на 11 000 гривен и уголь на 23 000 гривен, так как все дорожает, особенно уголь, а он нужен для того, чтобы подтапливать второй урожай.
texts.en:
Volodya has already applied for financial assistance from KIVA in the past. In due course, he used to last loan he received from KIVA to install a large boiler for heating his greenhouses. Now he has three more large greenhouses that he has heating systems in. This allowed Volodya to successfully sow two harvests - one in the early Spring and one in the Fall - without being afraid of frost. This also spurred a noticeable increase in revenue from clients. Now Volodya's son is serving as a border guard along with border with Russian in the Mariupol Region. Warfare is taking place there and Volodya is terribly worried about his son. The rest of Volodya's children live with him and his wife.

With the 40,000 hryvnia (UAH), Volodya plans to buy the necessities for the next planting season, specifically plastic coverings (for 6000 hryvnia), seeds (for 11,000 hryvnia) and coal (for 23,000 hryvnia). All of these items are getting more expensive, especially coal, but he needs them to ensure his second harvest.

loans.use: to purchase plastic covering, seeds and coal.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 54 años de edad es viuda y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 24 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su empeño a logrado sacar adelante a su hija que actualmente es una mujer mayor de edad, Teresa se gana la vida desde hace 7 años como vendedora de productos de belleza por catalogo como: cremas de manos, lociones, desodorantes, champú, maquillaje, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza de forma ambulante por los cantones cercanos. Ella desea mejorar su negocio ya que ha observado que cada día son más los clientes que buscan sus productos, y además si compra por mayoreo sus ganancias son mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas de manos, lociones, desodorantes, champú, maquillaje, etc.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 54-year-old widow who lives in her own house with her 24-year-old daughter. She is a woman who, thanks to her effort, has been able to raise her daughter who is now an adult. 

For the past seven years Teresa has been earning a living by selling beauty products by catalog such as hand cream, lotions, deodorant, shampoo, makeup, etc. She does this by going door-to-door throughout the surrounding neighborhoods.  She wants to improve her business as she has realized that every day there are more and more people who want to buy her products, and furthermore, if she buys wholesale her profits increase. So she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in larger quantities of the same merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in hand creams, lotions, deodorant, shampoo, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is 56 years old and married with six children.

Paulita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, salt, sugar, etc.

Paulita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling recyclable materials.

Paulita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, coffee, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish and nipa roofing. Lilia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda, 49 years old, is married and has three children, who all attend school. She has been farming rice in the Philippines for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Reglyn

texts.en:
Reglyn is 24 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Reglyn has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Reglyn has been pig fattening for 5 years, and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Reglyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a degree.

loans.name: Alba Iris

texts.es:
Alba de 21 años de edad, tiene como nivel académico sexto grado, no pudo culminar la escuela por su situación económica, además debía colaborar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, ahora está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en el ejército como soldado, aún no tiene hijos y en casa solo habita él y su pareja.


Alba se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar niños de las personas que trabajan, ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en estos trabajos, todo inició cuando una amiga suya necesitaba que cuidaran a su hijo y entonces Alba aprovechó la oportunidad de hacerlo ella. Actualmente, durante las mañanas cuida a los hijos de una maestra y en las tardes a los de una amiga suya, trabaja de lunes a domingo a modo de que no le falten los ingresos económicos para salir adelante. 

Ella necesita este crédito para iniciar un negocio de ropa, comprara blusas, faldas, ropa para niños y pantalones y camisas para caballeros

Sus planes son arreglar su casa, tener hijos y que funcione el negocio que quiere iniciar.
texts.en:
Alba is 21 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She wasn't able to finish school due to her economic situation, and also had to help her mother with household chores. 

Now, she's partnered and her partner works in the army as a soldier. They still do not have children, and only her and her partner live in their house.

Alba earns a living through domestic work, and providing childcare for working people. She already has five years of experience in these jobs, all starting when a friend of hers needed her to look after her son, and thus Alba took the opportunity to do this for her. 

Currently, she watches a teacher's children in the morning, and the children of a friend in the afternoon. She works Monday through Sunday so that she doesn't lack the economic resources to get ahead.

She needs this loan to begin a clothing business. She will buy blouses, skirts, children's clothes, pants and shirts for men. Her plan is to do home repairs, have children and work the business that she wants to start.

loans.use: to start a clothing business, buying blouses, skirts, children's clothing, pants and shirts for men.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lizcel

texts.en:
Lizcel is 24 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Lizcel has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en:
Samoeurn  is a 47-year-old married woman .She has four dependent children, one of whom is a student and the other three are tailors. She lives in a small village in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice and sells the crops the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for twenty four years.

Samoeurn wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, gravel and bricks to repair the walls and construct cement columns in her home.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, 44 years old, is married to Lina and they are blessed with five children.  Fred and his wife both help each other manage their farm business. This is the only way they get their daily living expenses met. That's why Fred makes sure that he takes good care of their farm.

To have additional income, Fred is asking for a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide. 

Fred hopes that he can save enough money to rebuild their house so that he can provide a comfortable home for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertlilizer, seed and pesticide

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 45 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Lina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Lina has been farming rice for 6 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Veronica is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rinaly

texts.en:
Rinaly works hard to support her family. Rinaly is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Rinaly requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes like blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Rinaly has been in this business for 5 years now.

Rinaly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes like blouses, pants, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela una joven loca que vive su vida desorganizada, descomplicada, sonriente, estudiosa, y muy rebuscadora.
Es estudiante de ingeniería y se gana su vida vendiendo artesanías que ella misma fabrica, vende manillas, collares, productos en acero y oro goldfied y gracias a este negocio puede pagar la costosa matricula de su universidad es una joven de 22 años que da la vida pro el estudio y sin olvidar que es una joven, también vende productos por catálogo ropa y se contagia con todo lo que pueda hacer que le genere utilidad para la universidad y ayudar con cualquier cosa en la casa.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de un catálogo para decorar, un organizador para herramienta, comprara ropa para vender, comprara materia prima en acero, oro goldfied, y los hilos para sus artesanías.

Con el crédito fabricara más piezas que las venderá en su universidad y los alrededores de su vecindario buscando siempre un cliente que se acerque y le ayude con su negocio el cual le está pagando la universidad.
Su sueño es terminar sus estudios que para ello depende netamente de su negocio pues sus padres no pueden pagarle la matricula.
texts.en:
Daniela is a crazy young woman who lives a disorganized, relaxed life.  She is smiley, studious and very inquisitive. 
Daniela is studying engineering.  She earns her living selling handicrafts that she, herself, makes.  She sells handles, necklaces, and steel and gold-filled gold products.  Thanks to her business, Daniela is able to pay her costly university tuition.  She is a 22-year old young woman who gives her life for her studies, without forgetting that she is in her youth.  Daniela also sells clothing from a catalog, and she takes on whatever she can that will generate a profit to pay for her schooling and help with whatever is needed at home. 
Daniela is requesting the loan to purchase a decorating catalog, a tool organizer and clothing for re-sale.  She will also purchase raw materials in steel, gold-filled gold and thread for her handicrafts. 

With the loan, Daniela will be able to make more pieces, which she will sell at the university and in the areas surrounding her neighborhood.  She is always on the lookout for customers who may take an interest in what she is doing and help with her business, which is how she is paying for her university studies. 
Daniela's dream is to finish her studies, and doing that depends solely on her business.  Her parents cannot pay her tuition.

loans.use: to purchase a decorating catalog, a tool organizer, steel, gold-filled gold and thread for her handicrafts, which pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Bemary

texts.en:
Bemary is single and she is working in a private company in order to make a living. She earns additional income through selling cosmetic products in her office and her community and is able to support her parent's basic needs. 

She is planning to build a store in their village to let her parents manage while she is working.  Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more cosmetic products to sell and a portion will also go toward buy new tires to replace the old used tires of her vehicle used for transportation. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell and a portion will also go toward buying new tires

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is 36, married and a mother of three children. She is an educated lady and has been running a school in her community. She is respected by everyone in the community. She introduced a specific book syllabus for her school as she wants to deliver extra curriculum knowledge through teaching. So, some of syllabus books are not easily available in local book shops. Therefore, Aliya has decided to run a book shop in her school's stationary shop. 

However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult to buy these books. Therefore, she has applied for a loan in order to provide the school books to her students. She is hopes for a better future for her students and to be a role model for many in the community.

Aliya is thankful to KIVA and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy school books to sale for her own school

loans.name: M. Shabbir

texts.en:
M. Shabbir is from the beautiful city of Lahore, Pakistan. He is 26-years-old, married  and has a son. He is a friendly, hard working, and honorable person. 

He owns a construction material shop in which he sells marble tiles and provides floor polishing services also.  Recently he invested a lot of money purchasing many tiles. He has been spending his savings for household expenses and now he does not have sufficient cash in hand. 

Therefore, M. Shabbir has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan to purchase marble tiles of various colors and marble cutting machine thus increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to buy marble tiles of various colors and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Progresando
Barranca, Puntarenas
Son 3 mujeres trabajadoras de la zona de Barranca. Tiene amplia experiencia  de trabajo en sus negocios. El grupo recibe la capacitación y se forma dentro de la metodología de Solidaria Mujer. El grupo cuenta con ingresos establecidos gracias a una cartera de clientes consolidada, indican que su recuperación es a 30 días, o cobran quincena cuentas grandes, lo que les permite tener ingresos para cubrir la cuota del préstamo, además se comprometen a ahorrar un monto de 9000 colones, con el objetivo de tener un respaldo para el pago.

Sharlyn, tesorera del grupo es una  joven de 20 años, estudiante y con trabajo temporal, busca mejorar sus condiciones de vida buscando ingresos para mejorar su capacitación y conseguir mejores oportunidades de empleo, se dedica a la venta de ropa y bisutería con lo que paga sus estudios y apoya a su hogar con ingresos económicos, tiene un trabajo como secretaria en una clínica de la zona de Puntarenas.

Sus otras dos integrantes son María Isabel y Zaida, todas cuentan con  experiencia en el comercio, compromiso de trabajo, demuestran cualidades buenas para la organización grupal, y plantean actividades complementarias para mejorar su gestión  El crédito les va  a permitir tener un capital adicional para poder ofrecer mejores condiciones a sus clientes para aumentar así sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Solidaria Mujer Mujeres Progresando Group are three working women from the Barranca zone. They have a lot of experience working in their businesses. The group receives training and is formed within the methodology of Solidaria Mujer. 

The group relies on established incomes, thanks to a consolidated base of regular customers. They say their recovery time is 30 days, and covers 15 large accounts, which allows them to have income to cover loan payments. They also promise to save a sum of 9,000 colones, with the goal of having a backup for payment.

Sharlyn, the group's treasurer, is a 20 year old young woman and student with temporary work. She seeks to improve her life conditions, looking for income to improve her training and get better employment opportunities. She earns a living selling clothing and jewelry, with which she pays for her studies and supports her household with income. She has work as a secretary in a clinic in the Puntarenas zone.

The other members are María Isabel and Zaida. All have experience in retail, commitment to work. They demonstrate good qualities for group organization and plan complimentary activities to improve their management. The loan will allow them to have additional capital to be able to offer better conditions to their customers, thus improving their income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothing, jewelry and perfume, among others.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 11 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer con una buena visión, para los negocios ya que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos en su comunidad, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Maria necesita recoger agua para el uso del hogar y el piso de su vivienda es de tierra por lo que, desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y construir una pila, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillos y hierro para construir una pila y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria, 28 years old, lives in her own house together with her two children, 11 and 3 years old. She is a woman with a good vision for business. 

For a long time, she's earned a living selling typical snacks in her community, an activity that allows her to raise her two children. 

Maria needs to collect water for household use, and the floor of her house is earth. Because of this, she wants to cement her house's floor and build a sink. 

For this, she's seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a sink and cement her house's floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a sink and set the floor of her home in cement.

loans.name: Yaneth Esmeralda

texts.es: Yaneth tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos y su padre.  Yaneth es una mujer conocida por su laboriosidad dado que hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su familia. Ella barre y cocina en el centro escolar de su localidad y en sus tiempo libres se dedica a la venta de variedad de antojitos típicos dentro de su comunidad. Ella es la encargada de la economía y la educación de sus hijos dado que hace un tiempo se divorció de su esposo.  Yeneth solicita nuevamente un crédito a FUSAI dado que en esta ocasión desea construir el corredor de su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, hierro, etc. Con el primer crédito logró construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en: Yaneth is 39-years old and lives in her own home with her three children and her father.  Yaneth is a woman known for being industrious; she does whatever she can to support her family.  She cleans and cooks at a school in her neighborhood, and in her free time she sells a variety of traditional snacks in her community.  She is the one responsible for her children's finances and education as she and her husband divorced some time ago.  Yaneth is requesting a new loan from FUSAI.  This time she wants to build a passageway for her home.  To do that she needs materials, such as galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, iron etc.  With the first loan, Yaneth was able to build a perimeter wall for her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, iron etc. to build a passageway for her home.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Valentina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more materials for her business.

Valentina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es: Ceferina de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 23 y 24 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, además gracias a su esfuerzo pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos ya mayores de edad, los cuales le apoyan en la economía del hogar. Ceferina desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía está bastante deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ceferina, who is 57-years old, lives in her own home with her two children who are 23- and 24-years old respectively.  She is an enterprising woman who, for a long time, has made her living offering live-in domestic services.  In addition, thanks to her efforts, she was able to get her children, who are now grown, ahead.  They now help her with the household finances. Ceferina wants to repair her home's roof.  As you can see in the above photo, it is pretty deteriorated.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She needs to purchase galvanized sheet metal, beams and fasteners to repair her home's roof.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, beams and fasteners to repair her home's roof.

loans.name: Elza Leticia

texts.es: Elza tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Ella es una mujer luchadora que con muchos esfuerzos va sacando adelante a su familia. Ella trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante cercano a su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Elza solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea repellar  todas las paredes de su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena, cemento y pagar la mano de obra necesaria para el repello de las paredes.  Expresa estar muy agradecida dado que con el primer crédito logró construir un baño y conectó las tuberías de aguas negras. Nuevamente se compromete a cancelar las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Elza is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her parents and her two children. She is a tenacious woman that with a lot of effort is getting her family ahead. She works as a cook in a restaurant near her town, which allows her to cover the household expenses. Elza is requesting this loan from FUSAI as she wishes to plaster all of the walls in her house. For this, she will need materials such as sand and cement, and to pay for the cost of labor required to plaster the walls. She is very thankful because she was able to build a bathroom and connect the sewage pipes with her first loan. She promises to once again repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and to pay for the cost of labor required to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет в Новой Каховке. Она торгует на местном центральном рынке стильной женской одеждой, арендуя землю у администрации рынка. Зимой торгует в основном куртками, в теплое время года — юбками, платьями, брюками, блузками и кофтами, в основном, турецкого производства. Один бутик у нее в собственности, второй она арендует. В торговле Наталья занята уже 6 лет. 
Наталья планирует на сумму 40 000 гривен пополнить ассортимент теплой одежды, пальто, курток, а также купить партию юбок, блузок и брюк. Хороший стабильный бизнес, достаточный опыт торговли, ходовой товар и постоянные клиенты стимулируют Наталью продолжать заниматься этим бизнесом и вкладывать в него силы и средства.
texts.en: Natalya lives in Novaya Kahovka. She sells stylish women's clothing at a local central market and leases the land from the market administration. She sells jackets in the winter and skirts, dresses, trousers, blouses and cardigans in the summer, all primarily made in Turkey. She owns one boutique and leases the second one. Natalya has been involved in retail for 6 years. Natalya plans to use the sum of 40 000 hryvnia to add to her selection of warm clothing, such as coats and jackets, and also to buy a selection of skirts, blouses and trousers. Good, stable business, sufficient work experience, popular merchandise and regular clients motivate Natalya to continue this business and invest her efforts and means into it.

loans.use: to purchase coats and jackets, as well as skirts, blouses and pants for resale

loans.name: La Capillita Group

texts.es:
4 mujeres trabajadoras y con ganas de superarse son quienes conforman el grupo llamado “La Capillita”. Las integrantes eligieron el nombre pues en el barrio donde viven hay una capilla que además se ubica muy cerca de la casa donde se reúnen para la cobranza. La mayoría de los habitantes en la región trabajan en el campo por tratarse de una zona cañera, los demás trabajan en pequeños negocios como purificadoras de agua, talleres mecánicos, etc.

El barrio también es conocido debido a que hace más de 15 años una fábrica, importante fuente de empleo, dejó de funcionar. Ahora la infraestructura se puede observar desde lejos.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:

Silviana - Cría Y Venta De Cerdo
Esperanza – Venta De Abarrotes
Nicolaza - Venta De Abarrotes
Concepción - Venta De Ropa Y Maíz

Doña Esperanza es una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre, empática y amable quien desde hace  18 años abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes gracias al apoyo de su esposo. Sus ganancias las invirtió principalmente en los estudios de su hijo. 

Hace unos días doña Esperanza decidió solicitar nuevamente un préstamo a VisionFund México para comprar  arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, agua, jabón, queso, galletas, refrescos, crema, mayonesa, frijol, maíz, chiles enlatados, entre otras cosas. Con la variedad de mercancía sabe que ofrecerá un mejor surtido a sus clientes. Esperanza explicó lo que más le agrada de su actividad: la manera en que sus clientes la hacen reír. Además, el tipo de negocio le ofrece la posibilidad de permanecer en casa para no descuidar a su familia y obtener un ingreso. 

Las 4 integrantes del grupo agradecen a Kiva y a VisionFund México por brindarles la oportunidad de crecer con sus negocios y de esta manera ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

*En la imagen: doña Esperanza viste una blusa a rayas rojas/blancas.
texts.en:
Four hardworking women who want to improve themselves make up La Capillita Group.  They chose the name [The little chapel] because there's a chapel in their neighborhood that's near the house where they meet to collect the money.

The majority of the residents in the region work in the fields because it's a cane-growing region; the others work in small businesses such as water purification, repair shops, and so on.  The neighborhood is also known because a factory that had been an important source of jobs closed more than 15 years ago.  Now the building can be seen from afar.

The members and their jobs are: Silviana raises and sells pigs, Esperanza sells groceries, Nicolaza sells groceries, and Concepción sells clothing and corn.  Esperanza's a very hardworking, happy, and friendly woman who opened a grocery store 18 years ago thanks to her husband's support.  She invested her profits mainly in her son's education.

Esperanza decided a few days ago to request another loan from VisionFund México to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk, water, soap, cheese, cookies, soft drinks, cream, mayonnaise, beans, corn, canned chili peppers, and other products.  She knows she'll offer her customers a better selection with this variety of merchandise.

Esperanza explained what she likes most about her job: the way her customers make her laugh.  Besides, this type of business allows her to stay at home and not neglect her family while she's earning an income.

The fours members of the group are grateful to Kiva and to VisionFund México for giving them the opportunity to grow with their businesses, thus giving their families a better quality of life.

In the photograph, Esperanza's wearing a red-and-white striped blouse.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from operating a motorcycle transport service and farming coconuts. 

Lucia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 11000 to buy ingredients for her food production business such as milk, flour, sugar, baking ingredients, etc. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, flour, sugar, baking ingredients, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет в городке Першотравенск. У нее несколько торговых точек: на местном рынке, свой магазин «Мир огородника», а также 3 арендованных торговых точки. Опыт работы — более 9 лет. Торгует в основном удобрениями, семенами, ядохимикатами, комнатными цветами, глиняными горшками, а также канцелярскими товарами, чулочно-носочными изделиями и шапками. 
Наталья планирует закупить товар на сумму в 40 000 гривен, а именно приобрести канцелярию к сезону начала учебного года в Украине, а также горшки для цветов, пополнить ассортимент комнатных цветов.
texts.en: Natalya lives in the town of Pershotravensk. She has several retail outlets at a local market, her own "Gardener's World" store, and 3 leased retail outlets. She has 9 years of work experience. She primarily sells fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, indoor plants, clay pots, and also office supplies, stockings, socks and hats. Natalya is planning to purchase merchandise with the sum of 40 000 hryvnia, specifically office supplies for the start of the school season in the Ukraine, and also pots for flowers, and a selection of indoor plants.

loans.use: to purchase clay pots for flowers, a selection of indoor flowers, as well as office supplies for sale

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amancia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear and vegetables. 

Amancia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Amancia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine has been breeding chicken for at least 5 years. Breeding chicks is his main economic activity. The business helps him take care of his family. He repeatedly took the initiative to find credit from traditional banks but he was denied. 

Today, his farm not only grows with better management, but also has vet care for the chicks on a regular basis. Willing to take advantage of the local demand, he now wishes to obtain a loan from Zafen to cope with production difficulties. In the same process, this opportunity will grow his profits and help the community.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of chicks to increase sales.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Luzvilla is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Luzvilla has been raising poultry for 10 years, and also earns an additional income from selling dressed chicken, and pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two button-sewing machines in order to increase T-shirt production.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is 63 years old and married with two children.

Gwena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Gwena has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Gwena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей уже пользовался финансовой помощью КИВА. Благодаря своевременно полученным средствам Сергей открыл вторую точку на рынке в с. Водяное. Торговля идет неплохо, единственная проблема в том, что сейчас в Украине цены растут на все очень быстро и иногда приходится продавать товар по одной цене, а закупать новую партию его уже намного дороже, чем продали. Более того, много средств уходит на учебу сына, который в этом году заканчивает институт. 
В этот раз он обратился за помощью в размере 35 000 гривен, необходимой для закупки семян и угля для предстоящего сезона. Сергей хочет заранее приобрести все необходимое, так как все дорожает, особенно уголь, который,в основном, поставлялся с Донбасса, где сейчас идет война.
texts.en: Sergei has used Kiva's financial assistance before. Thanks to the timely received funds, Sergei opened a second retail outlet at a market in the Vodyanoye village. The sales are going well, but the only problem is that prices for everything in the Ukraine are going up fast, and sometimes he has to sell products at one price and buy another inventory for a lot more than he sold the previous one at. On top of that, a lot of money is going toward his son's education, who is graduating from a university this year. This time, Sergei requested a loan in the amount of 35 000 hryvnia, needed to buy seeds and coal for the next season. Sergei wants to buy everything necessary in advance because everything is getting expensive, especially coal, primarily delivered from the Donbas region, a site of the current war.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and coal for next farming season

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge de 34 años de edad, está soltero pero tiene una hija, él vive con su padre, solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado de educación básica ya que la escuela le quedaba muy lejos, de Jorge dependen su padre y sus hermanos. 

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura y también a la venta de cerdos desde hace más de diez años, estas actividades las aprendió de su padre el cual le apoya fuertemente a realizar el trabajo, Jorge trabaja todos los días y lo hace  en su comunidad pero a veces se desplaza a otros lugares.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos y ganado.

Su sueño ver a su hija que está lejos, también casarse en un futuro, formar una familia y  construir una casa.
texts.en:
Jorge, 34, is single, but he has a daughter.  He lives with his father.  He was only able to study up to third grade because the school was very far away.  Jorge's father and siblings depend on him.

Jorge has earned a living in agriculture and also selling pigs for more than 10 years.  He learned these jobs from his father, who helps him a lot in carrying out his work.  Jorge works every day in his community, although sometimes he goes to other locations.

He needs the loan to buy pigs and livestock.

His dream is to see his daughter, who is far away.  He also would like to get married in the future, have a family, and build a house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and livestock

loans.name: Ángel Jonathan

texts.es:
Ángel es un joven emprendedor de 26 años de edad, está acompañado y aún no tiene hijos, él vive con sus padres junto con su pareja.

Ángel se dedica al comercio y a la elaboración de pan, el negocio lo maneja junto con su esposa, él aprendió esta actividad trabajando anteriormente en otras panaderías, el negocio lo tiene en el lugar donde viven, por la mañana elabora el pan y por la tarde sale a venderlo en la comunidad.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales como es azúcar, harina, manteca entre otros para la elaboración de pan.

Su sueño es tener una panadería bien establecida, con buena maquinaria, también desea procrear un hijo y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Ángel, 26, is an enterprising young man.  He's in a relationship and has no children yet.  He and his partner live with his parents.

Ángel earns a living as a merchant and baking bread.  He and his wife run the business.  He learned this work in previous jobs in other bakeries.  His business is located where they live.  He makes the bread in the morning and goes out to sell it in the community in the afternoon.

He needs this loan to buy sugar, flour, shortening, and other ingredients for making bread.

His dream is to have a well-established bakery with good equipment.  He also wants to have a child and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, shortening, and other ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer and spare parts for the maintenance of her computers for her internet cafe business.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from document printing.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer and spare parts for the maintenance of her computers

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
As a  parent of one children, Maria Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from raising pigs.  Maria Theresa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen food to sell for her food vending business.

Maria Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen food

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maria Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell vegetables. Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell through her buy-and-sell fish business.

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of  fish to sell.

loans.name: Abellard

texts.en: Abellard Hardware is a construction hardware company. The business was founded in 1994. Abellard dedicated its efforts to serve everyone in the community of Delmas, a suburb in the south of Port-au-Prince. The earthquake caused an increase in the demand for construction materials. Abellard wants to seize this opportunity to grow by requesting a loan through Zafen loan to purchase building materials including cement.

loans.use: to purchase stock of construction materials to sell

loans.name: Taytacha Señor De Ccoyllority De Yungaqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Canisia ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 9 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo en sus diferentes negocios porque no asistieron el dia de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI” communal bank.  The communal bank is located in the Anta District, which is a part of Anta Province and Cusco Department.

The member Sra. Canisia is single, 51-years old and has nine children.  Her business is raising and selling animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises and fattens them and later sells them in various markets.  Through this small business, she has been able to get her children ahead.  Sra. Canisia's dream is to have her own sales space from which to sell her guinea pigs and chickens.  She is requesting a loan to purchase guinea pigs, chickens and feed for the guinea pigs and chickens. 

The members that appear in the in-set photos had their pictures taken at their individual businesses.  They weren't at the meeting the day the group photo was taken; they had asked permission to miss the meeting due to conflicts with work. 
 
The other members make their livings by selling animals, with a livestock business, with a small grocery store and in agriculture. 

Sra. Canisia is grateful to those who form a part of this dream by making the loan possible, and she promises to comply with the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Ishfaq Hussain

texts.en:
Ishfaq Hussain is the age of 42, married, an energetic and gentle person. He lives with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He loves his children, parents and sibling a lot and wants to provide them with better facilities. He wants to earn a maximum income to ensure and secure the better future of his family members. 

He owns a scrap shop in which he deals with the used, damaged and useless scrap materials such as plastic, iron and aluminum accessories. He purchases scrap from the hawkers and sells it  to a recycling factory. He is committed with a factory, and at the end of the month the factory members collect all the scrap at a decided amount from him. He has been doing the same business for many years and earning a reasonable profit for his family. 

Nowadays, he made a deal with the contractor who is selling the scrap iron of a building; due to large quantity he does not have enough cash in hand to buy that scrap iron. 

Therefore, Ishfaq Hussain has requested a loan so that he can buy the scrap iron from the contractor and can make a rapid increase in his income.

Ishfaq Hussain hopes that this loan will enhance the earning capacity. In this way he would be able to make more savings than earlier.

Ishfaq Hussain seems very glad after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap iron from a contractor for reselling.

loans.name: M. Shabbir

texts.en:
M. Shabbir belongs to a poor family. He lives with his spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories, such as doors and windows, which are used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories, as well.

A few days ago, his welding plant became out of order due to overheating and it needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but he does not have cash in hand, due to lot of household expenses. This business is the single source of income for the entire family. 

Therefore, M. Shabbir has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that he would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.  

M. Shabbir gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant to manufacture iron accessories.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja en el taller familiar de sastrería y atiende por las mañanas un molino nixtamal, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales cuatro estudian en la escuela el nivel básico y la mayor lo apoya en el taller. 

Desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a Juan a trabajar fuertemente en la agricultura y ganadería, también él aprendió el trabajo de albañil.

Cuando tenía 20 años aprendió el trabajo de sastre, él elabora pantalones, camisas, blusas y otros. Gracias a su buena labor, él trabaja con las escuelas elaborando los uniformes de los estudiantes, para comprar los materiales que utiliza debe trasladarse a otro lugar, él compra al mayoreo para que le salga más barato.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar una novilla y para comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando uniformes escolares.
Juan sueña con ir creciendo poco a poco para lograr establecer un local fijo para la elaboración de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Juan is 37-years old.  He went to school until 9th grade.  He is married, and his wife works in the family's tailoring workshop.  In the mornings, she runs a corn mill.  Juan has five children, of whom four go to primary school, and the eldest helps in the workshop. 

At a very young age, Juan's parents taught him to work hard in agriculture and with livestock.  He also learned to be a brick layer. 

When he was 20-years old, Juan learned to be a tailor.  He makes pants, shirts, blouses and other items.  Thanks to his quality, Juan works with the schools making uniforms for the students.  To purchase the materials he uses, he travels to another area where he makes his purchases wholesale, and that is less expensive for him. 

Juan needs the loan to purchase a heifer and to purchase raw materials so he can keep making school uniforms. 

Juan hopes to grow his business bit by bit so that he can set up a permanent shop for making men's, women's and children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and to purchase raw materials to keep making school uniforms.

loans.name: Jeanny Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeanny Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes. Jeanny Ann is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stocks like canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, sanitary pads, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Jeanny Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like canned goods, bread, biscuits, noodles, sanitary pads, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maa Samlai Group

texts.en:
Gulapi is the leader of a group that lives in Bajantripara of Bolangir Town in the district of Bolangir, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 45 years. She has a small family comprising five members: her husband and two daughters, aged 12 and 10, and one son, aged 8. The member standing fourth from the left with a raised hand in the second row is Gulapi.
  
Like most families in the locality, she and her husband are running a rice shop in the market and maintain different qualities of rice. She sells rice in her shop. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Gulapi’s husband helps her in purchasing rice from different markets and in harvesting seasons to run the business smoothly. At present, her family’s income is Rs. 7,000 per month from her rice shop, which is not sufficient to maintain her family.
