To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail herself of a loan from Mahashakti. With the loan amount, she will purchase rice in bulk quantity to access a cash discount and also save transportation costs, which she incurs frequently. She has a dream to have a wholesale shop in the town and educate her children in a better school. 

The other 13 members of her group are Lata, Kalyani, Gita, Pakani, Gouri, Suchi, Surya, Shanti, Bishaya, Pratima, Rabi, Sonia, and Labani, who are doing individual businesses in the town.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Asghar Shehzad

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is named Asghar Shehzad. He is 41 years old and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for several years. He is the father of two daughters and three sons. His son is suffering from a fatal disease. He had him checked by a specialist but his disease is constant. He does not have more children so he wants to see his son healed and hearty. For this purpose, he has been spending a lot of money. 

Asghar Shehzad has to generate maximum profit from his current enterprise so that he can easily provide the medical treatment to his son. He wants to increase the stock in his general store on a daily basis so that he can generate maximum profit.

Therefore, Asghar Shehzad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he will be able to buy sacks of flour, sugar and cooking oil, etc.

Asghar Shehzad is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in getting maximum income this time so that he can provide better medical care to his son.
 
Asghar Shehzad is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar and cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Riyasat Ali

texts.en:
Riyasat Ali is the age of 34. He is a young and energetic person, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. In fact, his father started him in a new garments business and he is generating income for his entire family. After his father, he will be the next earning person for family. 

His shop is situated in the garments market and there are a lot of competitors who exist in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to purchase at a profitable price. This competition is the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delighting colors of garments in his shop so he can maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the winter season is about to start and he does not have a sufficient amount to buy winter season's garments. If he fails to replace the summer season's garments with winter season's garments, then it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income as well.

Therefore, Riyasat Ali  has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so the he will be empowered to buy the garments of the winter season. 

Riyasat Ali hopes that he will purchase garments according to his desire at the right time so that he can cope with the market competition and can grow his income as well. 

Riyasat Ali thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy winter season's garments for reselling.

loans.name: Free Power Technology

texts.en: Suraj is the director of Free Power Technology, the brainchild of a group of young entrepreneurs from Guwahati in Assam. These entrepreneurs have joined hands together to venture into the field of green energy after having successful careers of more than 15 years individually in retail distribution. Wanting to make an impact in society, Free Power is leveraging its reach to over 150 dealers in seven states of the Northeastern region of India to bring solar solutions to Barefoot customers. Suraj has been distributing Barefoot products since March 2014. He is going to use this loan to scale up and reach out to 20,000 households and is looking to light 1,000 households in the tea plantations of Assam, which have limited access to grid power with Barefoot’s Connect range of products.

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is a 30-year old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of a baby girl.

Shahid has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy gents shoes for his shoe store. He has been selling shoes for many years. He has been selling ladies fancy and casual shoes in his hometown. Most of his customers demand gents shoes as well, but due to lack of availability of funds, he can not purchase gents shoes.
 
Therefore, Shahid has requested a loan so he can buy a variety of gents shoes for reselling purposes. In this way, he can easily cope with the demand and abstain from the customers' disappointment.
 
His shop is situated in the shoe market and lot of other shoe stores are available there, which becomes the cause of tough competition. He dreams of moving his shop to another place to abstain from the competitors.

Through the investment of current loan, he can easily establish his shoe store and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true.

Shahid thanks Kiva, honorable lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of gents shoes for reselling.

loans.name: M. Anees

texts.en:
M. Anees is the age of 38, the father of four children, living with his children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He has been manufacturing plastic accessories using a compression molding machine. He has a few molding machines; he has appointed workers on daily wages for manufacturing plastic accessories. In doing this, he is providing the source of income for unemployed persons as well.  A few days ago one of these molding machines has become out of order due to overheating. In fact, the molding machine consists of a heater inside which sparked due to a fluctuation in electricity. This machine got extra ordinary damage which cannot be repaired or renewed.
 
M. Anees wants to buy a new compression molding machine to continue his business. He has to complete his tasks on specific given time but he is unable to complete them in the absence of a machine. Therefore, he has contacted with Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented his humble request for a loan.  

He seems very happy after receiving this loan. He thanks Kiva and hopes that lenders will take an active part to support him.

loans.use: To buy raw material for manufacturing.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como soldador de estructuras metálicas como: balcones, puertas, y portones de hierro, además se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de  maíz y frijol para el consumo. La vivienda de Santiago esta a medio construir ya que le falta repellar  las paredes, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento y arena para repelar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
50-year old Santiago lives in his own house with his wife and two children aged 12 and 8. He is a hardworking man who earns his living soldering metal structures such as balconies, doors, and iron gates. He is also a farmer and grows maize and beans.

Santiago's house is half-built as the walls need to be plastered. For this reason he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement and sand.

loans.use: Buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of his house

loans.name: Natividad De Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura acompañada por su compañero de vida, ella siembra maíz y maicillo tanto para el consumo como para la venta. Como se puede observar en la fotografía la vivienda de Natividad está a medio construir, porque le falta financiamiento para terminar de colocarle ladrillo al piso es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para colocar ladrillo de piso a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Natividad, 43, lives in her own house with her life partner.  She's an enterprising woman who has worked in agriculture for 30 years with her companion.  She grows corn and millet, both for consumption and to sell.

As seen in the photograph, Natividad's house is half built, because she lacks the financing to finish putting in the floor tiles.  That's why she's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, and gravel to lay the floor in her house.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
Willian de 36 años de edad, esta casado y actualmente tienes tres hijas, la mayor tiene 11 años y estudia; las segundas son gemelas tienen 5 años y empiezan a estudiar parvularia.

Willian describe que por diversos problemas económicos en su familia, él no pudo estudiar, pero que con el tiempo aprendió varios oficios, entre ellos la pesca y mecánica, actualmente trabaja casi a tiempo completo en estructura mecánica.  Aprendió este oficio de un amigo y en tiempos libres se dedica a la pesca para poder mantener a su familia.

El préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar Madera, clavos y lamina; Ya que su casa se encuentra un poco deteriorada, y él teme por su familia y sobre todo en la temporada de invierno.

El sueño de Willian es que sus hijas puedan superarse y ampliar su negocio para generar ganancias que le permitan suplir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Willian is 36 years old, married, and has three daughters, the eldest of whom is 11 and a student. The next two are 5-year old twins who are just starting kindergarten.

Because he comes from a poor family Willian was not able to go to school. However, over the years he has learned many skills such as fishing and auto mechanics. Now he works almost full time as a mechanic, having learned about mechanics from a friend. He also works as a fisherman in his free time to earn money to support his family.

The loan Willian is seeking from CrediCampo is to buy wood, nails, and roofing as his house is in need of repair. He worries about his family especially in the winter. His dream is to see his children do well and expand his business so they can help support the family.

loans.use: Buy wood, nails, and roofing to repair his house

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, se dedica a vender comida y variedad de cosméticos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, no tiene  ayuda económica de parientes en el extranjero; en el negocio colabora toda la familia, es la fuente de ingresos con la que van subsistiendo.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar variedad de cosméticos, bebidas, carnes, verduras, condimentos y otros productos para fortalecer su actividad económica, así mantendrá la materia prima para elaborar la comida y surtirá de nuevos  cosméticos a sus clientes, administrará bien el préstamo para lograr aumentar sus ventas e ingresos que utilizara para los gastos de su hogar y el pago de la deuda.
Para Flor mantener su negocio funcionando y alcanzar que sea autosostenible es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Flor earns a living selling food and a variety of cosmetics.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She doesn't receive any financial support from relatives abroad.  She works with the entire family in her business; it's their source of income to keep on surviving.

She's going to use the loan to buy a variety of cosmetics, beverages, meat, vegetables, condiments, and other products to strengthen her economic activity.  That way she'll maintain the ingredients for making the food and she'll supply her customers with new cosmetics.  She'll administer the loan well to manage to increase her sales and income, which she'll use for the household expenses and for paying her debt.

Flor's biggest dream is to keep her business running and to become self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beverages, meat, vegetables, condiments, and other products

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es: Carolina de 23 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 2 años de edad y 3 meses de edad. Es una mujer que cada día busca como apoyar con la economía del hogar, por lo que se dedica a elaborar tortillas en su cantón, mientras su esposo trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda cercana realizando diferentes tipos de trabajos de campo como: siembra, limpieza de maleza, cosecha, etc. Carolina tiene 4 años de habitar en su vivienda que aunque es humilde es propia, por lo que se siente muy contenta, pero el techo de la misma se encuentra deteriorado como se puede observar en la fotografía, por lo que ella desea cambiarlo, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar materiales como: lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
23-year old Carolina lives in her own house with her husband and two children, one aged 2 and the other 3 months. She is the kind of woman who is always seeking ways to help her family. She earns her living making tortillas in the neighbourhood while her husband works as a laborer in a nearby farm. He does a variety of jobs such as planting, weeding, and harvesting.

Carolina has lived in her home for four years, and although it is simple, it is her own so she feels happy. However, the roof is in need of repair (see photo) so she wishes to change it. For this reason she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy materials such as galvanized sheeting, cement, sand, and beams to renew the roof of her house.

loans.use: buy materials such as galvanized sheeting, cement, sand, and beams to renew the roof of her house

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 51 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice and pre-paid mobile load.

Mercy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Ricky is single and lives with his family in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He helped his parents operate an agriculture business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ricky has been working in their farm with his parents and is earning well from this. The farm is still doing well but he still needs financial assistance to to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester. He studies at university to have a better future. He has requested a new loan from GDMPC where he had joined recently. He wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and has only one child. Due to family conflicts, she was separated to her husband. Despite this, she has the determination to improve their status of living. She engages in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. She aims to further improve this business, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. Being a patient and hardworking mother, she believes that she will be able to improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Mitchell

texts.en:
Mitchell is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mitchell is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Mitchell has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish

loans.name: Percie

texts.en:
Percie is 42 years old and married with five children. For the past eight years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling eggs, buying and selling fish, and raising ducks. Percie works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 24 previous loans from NWTF.

Percie is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell such as spices, milk, sugar, eggs, and other items. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy household goods such as spices, milk, sugar, eggs, and other items

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily, 39, is a smallholder farmer based in the Litein area of Kenya. The mother of one has been doing farming for the last eight years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea and other crops. She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is dairy farming. Her hobby is milking 'Potri' (name of her cow). However, her biggest challenge is rearing of animals. She feels she still has a lot to learn about rearing. 

Lily is seeking a loan from KIVA lenders for a dairy cow. The new cow she will purchase is projected to produce over 10 litres of milk each day. This additional volume of milk will fulfil the growing demand in the market and boost her returns. With those returns, Lily will be able to make the loan instalments on time. She will also be in a better position to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Mel Glory

texts.en:
Mel Glory is 57 years old and married with four children. For the past 15 years, she has been raising livestock in the Philippines. Mel Glory also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Mel Glory is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling slippers business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of slippers to sell for her business.

Reynelda has been in this business for five years. Reynelda earns more income from raising livestock.

Reynelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of slippers to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Norma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: M. Zohaib

texts.en:
M. Zohaib is a 31-year-old man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a small crockery store, where he sells utensils and crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glass, jugs, mugs, cauldrons, and buckets. 

M. Zohaib is a father of two children and a single responsible person who has to feed them. He has only one source of income. He has to afford the expenses of utility bills and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark according to the living standard.

M. Zohaib wants to buy more inventory to sell because most of his female customers purchase utensils in large quantities for making a dowry. For this purpose, more inventory is required to cope with the sudden increase in the demand.

He has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy utensils and crockery items and can generate more income.

M. Zohaib is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed him a beam of hope to fulfill his desires.

loans.use: To buy utensils and crockery

loans.name: Nazim Ali

texts.en:
Nazim Ali is the age of 46, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his four children and old parents as well.
 
Nazim Ali is a milkman by profession, and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since 1993, now he is very expert and experienced in his profession. He is very expert at producing milk from a buffalo; he produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day he takes his herd to the pasture for grazing, gives them a bath in the stream, and he has to stay with them the whole day due to a fear of theft. He has not much time for his family members. 

Nazim Ali wants to get an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford the salary. 

Nazim Ali is receiving his second loan, and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of last loan, he has purchased a buffalo and has benefited from that buffalo. He still wants to establish his business, and wants to buy a buffalo so that he can increase his monthly income, get an assistant, and spend some time with his family. 

Therefore, Nazim Ali has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Nazim Ali hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo and he will be successful in increasing his monthly income as well. 

Nazim Ali thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Condrado

texts.en:
Condrado owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Condrado has been engaged in his business for over 10 years, and earns well from these activities. He had supported his family from this farm, and yet had done many improvement of their house. His farm is still doing well and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. 

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Eufrecino

texts.en:
Eufrecino is a 62-year-old father of five children. He is a very hardworking person and loving husband. He has been engaged in his farming business for 20 years. Eufrencio is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. He wishes that through his business he can see his children finish their studies.

Eufrencio is a strong and hardworking person, and he always make sure that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Loveness Kivule Group

texts.en:
Antipasi is a businessman who is in his mid-twenties, and he is single. For two years now, he has been managing a shop selling food: rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, maize, and baking flour. He works from 7am to 10pm daily and is able to realize a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is his fifth loan request to be apportioned among Loveness Kivule, a six member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Antipasi used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to improve his shop with missing stocks especially rice, sugar, cooking oil, maize, and baling flour which most people bought daily. He managed to receive an extra income which he used to pay his welfare costs. He dream to be a successful businessman with a better life.

Antipasi will use his loan to buy food stocks to resell.

loans.use: to buy food stocks to resell.

loans.name: Chinfa

texts.en:
Chinfa is married. She operates a transportation business while her husband works on their farm to earn a living. Chinfa has been running her business for the past three years and she is happy to say that it helps a lot to provide for her family between harvests.

Chinfa is requesting a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy new tires to replace the old and used tires on her vehicle. In the future, she wants to have a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janeth is 40 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Janeth has a general store business in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Janeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Andrea, a 55 year old father who is humble, honest and a very hardworking father. He is the father of four lovely children that he really adores so much that he will do anything good to ensure that they never go to bed hungry. Andrea hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Andrea never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Andrea started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years he has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Andrea practices mixed farming on his farm and through the profits he has managed to take care of his family's needs and also give his children a good education (because he believes that education is the only “key to success”).

Andrea is a father who is very enterprising and he is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Andrea wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring people like Andrea to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing.

Andrea hopes that through the loan he will improve his living conditions. His dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Andrea is not a selfish person and will also want to impact positively on society by employing people to work for him on his horticulture farm.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like rope, hats, mirrors, etc. to sell.

Marigen has been in this business for 10 years. Marigen earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Marigen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods like rope, hats, mirrors, etc. to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 30 years, and sells a variety of items such as candies, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, etc. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, shampoo, detergent soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is 39 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Risa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Risa has been pig fattening for three years, and also earns additional income from selling piglets and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en:
Joachim is 60 years old and married with nine children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Joachim operates a piggery business and earns additional income from rentals and farming. He is hardworking man with the challenge of limited capital.

Joachim is requesting a loan to pay for labor on his farm. He dreams of increasing his business and buying a coffee milling machine.

loans.use: to pay for labor at his farm.

loans.name: Hadayat Ali

texts.en:
Hadayat Ali is 58-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of four sons and five daughters. 

He is a very hard working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers many types of delicious foods. He offers breakfast and lunch to his customers. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning an insufficient profit due to the ugly condition of his restaurant. He cooks delicious food for the restaurant, and the people like to eat from his restaurant. 

The condition of his restaurant is not good- scratched walls, low sitting arrangements, dark room and there are no electricity supplies available. The customer has to face problems and feels hesitant to come inside the restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his dear customers because due to these customers he earns his income.  

Hadayat Ali wants to establish his restaurant by redecorating his restaurant. He wants to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply, and buy new plastic furniture and new crockery.

Therefore, Hadayat Ali has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can maintain his restaurant in well manners so that it can look attractive.  

Hadayat Ali says thank to Kiva and appreciates the warm support to him.

loans.use: to redecorate the restaurant, to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply, and to buy new plastic furniture and new crockery.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33-year-old male; he does farming, growing crops like cassava. He started up a phone charging business to boost up his income and improve his standard of living.

He wishes to build a permanent home. Inadequate capital makes his business earn him less income.

He wants a loan to prepare his garden by buying seeds and pesticides, and paying for plowing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 38-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells spare parts, and earns a salary to increase his income. He started business to cater to his family's needs.

Rashid wishes to educate his children however, he is challenged with inadequate capital.

He wants to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bananas, ginger, sweet potatoes, potatoes, onions, and cabbage to resell

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen is a single entrepreneur who has run a bakery for four years to make a living.  He earns enough from his business that he is able to help his parents' needs.  Improving his business becomes easier with his access to GDMPC micro finance services.  Recently, he took a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase additional raw ingredients in preparing pastries.  He wants to become successful in his business and wants to improve the general living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for preparing pastries.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 52 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos una niña de 6 años y 2 varones de 19 y 15 años de edad. Es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día por darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia por lo que trabaja como albañil independiente, pero al no ser un trabajo fijo también se desempeña como jornalero cuando no consigue trabajo de albañil, para mantener siempre la economía familiar, además su compañera de vida se desempeña como vendedora en una venta de quesos, lo que le permite apoyarlo económicamente. José vive en casa propia desde hace 13 años por lo que se siente feliz, pero ha observado que es necesario un corredor en su vivienda, por lo que con su experiencia de albañil desea construirlo pero para ello necesita un financiamiento, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, tubos de hierro, polines, pines y clavos para construir un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and three children, a 6 year old girl and two boys aged 19 and 15. He is a man who makes an effort every day to provide a better quality of living for his family. He works as an independent bricklayer. As it is not permanent work he will also work as day labor when he has no bricklaying work to support the family economy. Also his life companion works as a seller at a cheese shop which supports him economically.

José has lived in his own house for 13 years which makes him happy but he has observed that he needs a veranda on his house. With his experience as a bricklayer he wants to built it but he needs a loan. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized laminate, steel tubing, rafters, purlins and nails to construct the veranda on his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, steel tubing, rafters, purlins and nails to build a veranda on his house.

loans.name: Gregorio Jr.

texts.en:
Gregorio Jr., very active in the community, is also a very hardworking person. He always make sure that he has enough money to save for his children. Gregorio is working as an insurance coordinator for ASKI. He is very willing to serve others. He is 62 years old with four children. He has been engaged in a farming business for almost 22 years. 

To have additional income, he is requesting a loan amounting Php 10,000 to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds to grow.

Gregorio Jr. hopes that someday he can save enough money for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Melorna

texts.en:
Melorna is 44 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Melorna works very hard to provide for them.

Melorna runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like shampoo, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, coffee, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, coffee, detergent soap, noodles, etc. 

Melorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like shampoo, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, coffee, detergent soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 54 years old. She is childless and she lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya. For the last 20 years, Joyce has been doing mixed-farming to sustain her livelihood. Her primary source of income is tea. As opposed to dairy farming, which she finds challenging, Joyce finds tea farming to be very enjoyable.

Joyce is requesting a loan to pay for rabbits and start rearing them. She had plans to get into livestock and the time has come for her to actualize them. Rabbit farming in Kenya does not have a long history. Recently though, there have been several initiatives by NGOs and social enterprises to introduce rabbit farming to rural farmers with an assured market.  Rabbit farming has really picked up since it is very lucrative and only requires a small space to get started.

Joyce will use her loan to diversify her investment portfolio and provide her with a chance to lead other farmers by example. She will use the profit from her loan to deal with farm-related expenses. Joyce is striving to pull herself out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase for rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is married and has 3 children. She has been involved in business activities since 2006.  She started with her own working capital of $500.00. She has a kiosk in her house, and now she is requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to improve her business in the future. The loan, from Tuba Rai Metin, will be used to buy additional supplies such as eggs, biscuits, water, sardines, sugar, cooking oils, milk, detergent and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She is happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she will increase her incomes in the future.  She also has animals like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy eggs, biscuits, water, sardines, sugar, cooking oils, milk ,detergent and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay has been in his beauty parlor services for more than four years. He polishes nails, does hair coloring and other spa services.  The business is doing well, so that it has sustained his daily expenditures. 

He had joined GDMPC this year, and is borrowing a new loan for additional capital to buy hair and body spa solutions. He has competitors, but with his good services rendered to his costumers, he has no doubt of having more costumers to patronized his business. 

In the future, he wants to have more branches that provide the same services.

loans.use: to buy hair and body spa solutions.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 35 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Merle works very hard to provide for them.

Merle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, cereals, noodles, candies, snack foods, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell.

Merle has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, noodles, candies, snack foods, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Merle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, cereals, noodles, candies, snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like flour, oil, etc. for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for 4 years. Rowena earns additional income raising pigs.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lodinela

texts.en:
Lodinela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 5 years now.

Lodinela requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Lodinela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 33-year-old man, married with two children. He deals in alcohol distilling and also earns a salary from farming. 

He faces a challenge of limited capital; however, he hopes to have personal assets. He needs a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en: Bonefance is a 38-year-old man who is married with two children. He operates a butchery in Fortportal ,Uganda. He faces a challenge of limited capital but he hopes to have enough stock. He needs a loan to buy cattle for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 36-year-old man married with five children. He operates a retail shop where he sells cooking oil, soap, beer, and soda. He faces a challenge of limited capital. However, he hopes to have enough capital and healthy children. He needs a loan to buy more stock i.e. sugar, beer, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beer, and soap to sell

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Priscilla requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Priscilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Obdulio

texts.es:
Obdulio de 47 años de edad, no fue a la escuela ya que sus padres lo ponían a trabajar, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 4 hijos, uno vive en USA y los otros le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura.

Obdulio tiene alrededor de 7 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado, además desde pequeño trabajaba en el cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo. El negocio de ganado es por iniciativa propia, pues en una ocasión tenía dinero y compró una ternera y su vecino se la compró al doble, entonces Obdulio vio que era bue negocio.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar bueyes, ya que está alquilando un terreno y quiere aprovechar de pastar bastante ganado.

Sus planes son mejorar su casa, apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio para que no se queden como él y tengan mas oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Obdulio is 47 years old and never went to school as his parents put him to work. He is married and his wife does the housework. He has 4 children. One of them lives in the United States and the others help him with his farm work.

Obdulio has about 7 years of working buying and selling cattle. Also he has grown corn, beans and sorghum since he was small. He started the livestock business on his own initiative as at one time he had money and bought a calf and his neighbor bought it at double the price. Obdulio saw that it was a good business.

He needs a loan to buy oxen as he is renting land and he wants to take advantage of it to pasture enough cattle. His plans are to improve his house and support his children`s studies so they don`t end up like him but rather have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy oxen.

loans.name: Tulivyo Group

texts.en:
Chiku is a mother of three sons and one daughter who are at school. She is in her 30's and married. For two years now, Chiku supported her family by engaging with a poultry project where she owns an incubator machine especially for chick production. She started a few months ago, and now she is able to put 288 eggs in her machine and only 150 chicks get out. She sells these chicks to small poultry businesswomen around her street who grows them til they are big and ready for sell as meat. Chiku still looks for a better way and enough capital to improve her business. 

Aside from hatching chicks, she is also raises local chickens, about 50 chickens to sell. She is really a busy woman, trying her level way to support her family. She starts working from 05 am to 08 pm daily, just to oversee her chicks. whether they have enough food and water and sometime supplying the chicks that are demanded. With all of this work, Chiku is able to make a very small profit per month.

Chiku approached Tujijenge Tanzania for a loan support via Kiva to improve her poultry business. This is her first loan request to be apportioned among TULIVYO, the eight member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Chiku will use her portion of the loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds and eggs to produce chicks. Her desire is to manage a poultry farm, to improve her life, and be able to employ jobless people.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed and eggs to produce chicks.

loans.name: Welyn

texts.en:
Welyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc. for her food vending  business.

Welyn has been in this business for 13 years. Welyn earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Welyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 64 years old and widowed with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Vilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Unión Y Fuerza Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales uno de sus hijos aun depende de ella. Lleva más de 2 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de desayuno. Ella inicio este negocio por motivación de sus vecinas, ya que el ingreso que percibía era únicamente de su esposo, es así que decidió emprender este pequeño negocio para  poder ayudar en los  gastos de su hogar brindándoles  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Elizabeth logra cubrir algunos gastos que tienen en su hogar tales como alimentación, educación, vestimenta y los pagos de servicios. Su plan  para el futuro es que su hijo sea un profesional de éxito, y el de su negocio es abrir un restaurante. Ella utilizara el préstamo en la compra de utensilios y mercadería para su negocio. Elizabeth pertenece a la alcancía comunal “UNIÓN Y FUERZA”, el cual está conformado por 6 socias y en donde ocupa el cargo de presidenta. Ella se encuentra en la parte del medio con una casaca de color plomo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old She is in a relationship and has 4 children one of whom is still dependent on her. She has been a client of Edaprospo for two years and she works selling breakfasts. She started her business motivated by her neighbors as the money she got was from her husband. So she decided to start this small business to help with the household expenses and provide a better quality of living for her family. Through her efforts and work Elizabeth manages to pay some of the expenses of her household such as food, education, clothing and paying the utilities.

Her plan for the future is for her son to become a successful professional and turn her business into a restaurant. She will use the loan to buy utensils and merchandise for her business. Elizabeth belongs to the ``UNIÓN Y FUERZA” communal bank which is made up of 6 members with her being the President. She is in the center with a grey jacket.

loans.use: to buy utensils.

loans.name: Deepam Shg- Viragalur Group

texts.en:
Leemarose leads the Deepam group of four other women residing in the Viragalur village in the Trichy district of Tamil Nadu. Leemarose is the featured borrower. They are all hardworking married women, and to support their family's income and meet their monthly expenditures, they have to work. They are engaged in diverse occupations and either work as daily wage agricultural laborers, or as employees in small private firms, or they run their own small rural businesses. However, with their meager incomes, they still have some way to go in terms of improving their living conditions. For cooking, they mostly use the traditional chulhas, makeshift stoves that use firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.   
      
This five-member group is seeking a loan to purchase five Greenway cooking stoves. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. They intend to repay the loan in easy installments. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon products like lotion, lipsticks, body spray, perfume, etc. to sell for her direct selling Avon products business.

Rachel has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from retailing soft drinks.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon products like lotion, lipsticks, body spray, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 30, is a mother of two who lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is a poultry farmer with five years of experience in this space. Besides eggs being her primary source of income, she also holds a salary-paying job and runs other side businesses. 

She stated she loves and feels passionate about poultry keeping. Having chickens around makes her homestead feel African and homely. The demand for poultry products is always high in both rural and urban settings.  

Hellen is seeking a loan to buy more poultry. The higher the quantity of chickens, the cheaper the cost of running the farm and the higher the egg output. Your investment will help Hellen expand her business and reap the benefits of scaling it. 

The returns she will make from your investment will help her to pay for her children's education. She is banking on her children's education to provide a solid foundation on which her future generations will have the privilege of leading an improved livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Lyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

Lyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net for her business

loans.name: Roche Amor

texts.en:
Roche Amor works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Roche Amor requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for six years now.

Roche Amor would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, invirtió el financiamiento anterior en  materiales para cultivar maíz, lamentablemente no tuvo los resultados esperado,  la cosecha fue poca debido a la escases de lluvia, con los pocos ingresos que genero logro cancelar la deuda y proveer de lo más básico a su familia.
Por la facilidad de pago se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para tener de inmediato los recursos económicos para comprar maíz, abono, insecticidas y materiales para el regadillo, fortalecerá el negocio, espera aumentar su cosecha y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Pedro invested the previous loan in supplies he needed for his corn crop. Unfortunately, he did not achieve the results he desired; the harvest was poor due to the scarce rain.  With the little income he made, he was able to pay off his debt and provide very basic need items for his family.

Because of the ease of payment and the loan process, he decided to apply for a new loan so that he would have the economic resources readily available to buy corn, manure, insecticide, and other supplies for his irrigated crops.  This will help him to strengthen his business by increasing his harvest and improving his economic situation.

loans.use: to buy corn, manure, insecticide and supplies for his irrigated crops.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en: Iluminada is 57 years old and has three children. She is married. For five years she has been a vegetable vendor. Her passion is to plant fruits and vegetables in her backyard. One day, she harvested her vegetables like eggplant, tomato, and bitter gourd, and she was happy with her good harvest. She has been able to create a business from her passion. She displays all she has harvested, and she offers it for sale right away. Some of her customers buy it quickly because, according to them, her products are very fresh from the garden.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Linah

texts.en: Linah is a young farmer from Chebiemit, a remote village in Kapsowar Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is the mother of four children who has been doing farming for the last two years so that she can supplement her income from the salary she gets. Linah does crop farming and cattle keeping and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances to improve her farming and diseases. This has made her seek a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a sheep. With this sheep, her projections are that by the end of the year the sheep will have given birth to at least four other sheep. Through sheep keeping, she will be able to get sheep wool, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell sheep meat and sheepskin, which will be increasing her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky is studying at university for she believes that with better education, her future is at hand. She had three siblings living with her family. After she joined GDMPC, Jinky has found ways to lightened her parent's financial problems. She took a new loan recently to pay her tuition fees for the first semester. She wants to become successful in her studies and be able to find a better career in the near future.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rubilyn is 36 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Rubilyn has a rope-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Rubilyn has been in this business for five years. Rubilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies in order to continue growing the business.  She will buy bread, meat, potatoes, sauces, soft drinks, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita, is aged 56, married to a farmer and they're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 36 years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on purchasing their daily requirements. Due to inadequate capital for her business she would like to borrow PHP 5,000 to purchase chips, canned goods, beverages and breads to sell.   She's hoping that her business will continue to expand and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase chips, canned goods, beverages and breads to sell.

loans.name: Godofredo

texts.en: Godofredo, 58 years old, is from the community where 90% do a farming business as their work. A man with determination and hardworking in his family and business, Godofredo, has been engaged in the farming business for almost 15 years. His father taught him well how to have a good harvest. But despite the unconditioned weather, some of his crops have been destroyed. But he hopes that everything will be okay. Godofredo is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticide and pay for labor costs.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, pesticide and labor for his fram

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk and sugar

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 28, is a diligent farmer based at Nyamira region of Kenya. Hellen has sustained her livelihood over the last three years through selling milk, eggs, and tea produced at her farm. Mixed farming is a very common practice among farmers from Nyamira. 

Hellen finds dairy farming, poultry keeping, and tea farming to be sustainable and very fulfilling. However, her biggest challenges are the high farming cost. Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. To resolve this challenge, she joined Juhudi Kilimo (a micro-finance that finances smallholder farmers). 

Your loan contribution will enable Hellen to afford her highest monthly expenses, farm-related, comfortably and channel the surplus amount to her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 42-year-old woman. She is a mother of three children. She earns her living by doing embroidery work. She is very famous in her town for the aesthetic designs that she makes. Her husband’s income was not enough for the household. Therefore, she began to assist him in providing for the family. She has been able to expand her clientele over the years. Her business is constantly expanding as a result. In her sixth loan cycle, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She is hopeful that by expanding her business, she will be able to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors

loans.name: Siena

texts.en:
Siena is a 48-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Siena requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Siena has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Siena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián, un joven de 21 años, vive en el municipio de Itagüí, una pequeña ciudad donde las oportunidades de salir adelante son difíciles y la competencia comercial es bastante dura.

Este joven de mente emprendedora y grandes deseos de salir adelante tiene el proyecto de iniciar con un negocio de comidas rápidas en el parque principal del municipio, en un pequeño puesto de comidas.

Con la ayuda de un préstamo, Sebastián podrá cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y poder generar sus propios ingresos, con los que pagara sus estudios y aportara a los gastos de su hogar.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de un parasol, sillas, uniformes, publicidad y surtido de insumos e ingredientes.
texts.en:
Sebastian is a young man of 21 who lives in the Municipality of Itagui, a small city in which the opportunities to get ahead are difficult and the commercial competition is pretty tough.
This young man with an enterprising mind and big wishes to get ahead has the plan to start with a fast food business in the main park of the municipality in a small food stall.
With the help of a loan, Sebastian will be able to fulfill his dream of being independent and able to earn his own income with which he will pay for his studies and contribute to the household expenses.
The money will be invested in the purchase of a parasol, chairs, uniforms, advertising, and an assortment of supplies and ingredients.

loans.use: to buy a parasol, chairs, uniforms, advertising, and an assortment of ingredients in order to start a fast food business.

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.es:
María, es propietaria de una pupuseria, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de un año, ambos comparten la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y formar un patrimonio para su familia; el negocio se lo enseño su mamá desde muy joven, ella se independizo y actualmente al realizar esta actividad genera ingresos económicos para aportar en los gastos familiares, la venta de pupusas la realiza por las tardes, atiende sola a sus clientes y ya tiene  mucha demanda de sus productos.
Invertirá en la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, repollo, aderezos, harina y otros ingredientes que son parte de la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera atender mejor a sus clientes, ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad, así como también tener una economía más estable.
Sus proyectos son incorporar un nuevo rubro para tener nuevos ingresos, dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y manejar una buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Maria is the owner of a pupuseria, selling stuffed tortillas.  She lives with her life companion and their one year old son.  Both share the responsibility for covering the needs of their household and forming a good financial basis for their family.  Maria's mother taught her this business from a young age.  She began to support herself and now does this work to generate income to share in family costs.  Maria sells the pupusas in the afternoons, and is the only person taking care of the customers.  There is already much demand for her products.

Maria will invest the loan money in purchase of sausage, cheese, chicken, condiments, floor and other ingredients that are part of the basic materials for making and selling pupusas.   She hopes to better serve her customers, offering fresh high-quality products, and also thus have stable income.  Her plans are to make a new effort to increase her income, provide an improved life style for her family and have a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy sausage, cheese, chicken, condiments, flour and other ingredients for making pupusas

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en: Hajran, age 32, deals in the business of selling clothes. She is a married woman and has five children. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. Hajran is famous among her neighbors and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase good quality clothes of different colors.  She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase good quality clothes of different colors.

loans.name: Iftikhar Ali

texts.en:
Iftikhar Ali is the age of 39. He is a young and energetic person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of five children and lives near his clothing shop. This clothing shop is the only source of income for his family. For this reason, he devotes all his all efforts and time to the garment shop. 

His shop is situated under the clothing market and there is a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing for his shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the winter season is about to start and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy clothing related to the winter season. If he cannot replace the winter season's clothing with summer season's clothing, it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and his monthly income. 

Therefore, Iftikhar Ali has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can be empowered to buy winter season's clothing.

Iftikhar Ali hopes that he will purchase clothing according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and could grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: To buy winter season clothing to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 43-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a produce business, i.e.buying and selling maize and beans. He also earns from banana farming. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations of agricultural products but has hopes of having enough capital and a healthy family. He needs a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 38-year old married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Vilma has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a 44-year-old man with 6 children of which 3 attend school. He also has 5 dependents. He is a farmer and also earns from his small retail shop. Limited capital is his challenge but he hopes to educate his children. He needs a loan to improve his coffee nursery bed.

loans.use: to improve his coffee nursery bed.

loans.name: Sedius

texts.en: Sedius is a 33-year-old man with three children, one of whom attends school. He also has two dependents. He deals in farming and also earns from a local bar. He faces a problem of limited capital but hopes to educate his children and construct a house. He needs a loan to buy beers, sodas and waragi (a distilled beverage) to sell in the bar.

loans.use: to add stock of beers, sodas and waragi to sell in his bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, longanisa, bologna (pork sausages), hot dogs, chicken heads and seasonings

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 26 years old and has a motorcycle transport business in Kakamega town. He is married to Miriam and together they have been blessed with 2 children. He also supports four members of his family.

He will be using this loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and service it and keep it in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In the future Benjamin hopes to buy land and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is aged 42 and still single. She has managed a hog raising business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog for every three months. She also gives some financial support for the education of her nieces. She would like to take a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed for her hogs. She's hoping that the generous lenders will grant her loan so that she can utilize it properly for her hog raising business.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a woman who stands out for searching any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family. Two years ago she started selling grocery goods in her village while her husband does farming to make a living.  She thanks God and her clients for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very rewarding.  Based on this success, Leonor is asking for a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian works hard to support her family. Vivian is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Vivian requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vivian has been in this business for 5 years now.

Vivian would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adeha

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Adeha works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling seafood. Adeha is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell in her dried fish business.

Adeha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 40 years now.

Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.en:
Ercilia is married and has one child. The family also has pigs and a dog.

Using 300 USD of her own, Ercilia opened a small shop two years ago. It was difficult, however, because she didn’t have enough working capital to stock her store adequately.

Then she found out about Tuba Rai Metin and is now applying for an 800 USD loan. With the money she will buy eggs, sugar, salt, sardines, candles, shampoo, soap, detergent, cooking oil, soft drinks and other groceries to sell.

Ercilia is happy to be busy working on her shop, as she wants it to grow ever bigger.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 31 years old and lives in Kakamega. His wife and he have been blessed with three children.

For the past six years Robert has worked raising cattle. He is applying for a 45,000 KES loan through VisionFund Kenya to buy more livestock. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's needs.

Robert’s future hopes are to be successful in his business and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools such as a router to improve the making of his handicrafts and thus be able to generate more income for his 2-year-old baby.

loans.name: Naef

texts.en:
Naef is a 31-year-old married man with two children; one is ten years old, and the other is two. The family lives in Yemen’s capital city, Sana'a.

Naef owns a restaurant in the city that was opened by his father ten years ago. As time went by, his father grew older and unable to run the business, so Naef took over.

Now Naef operates the restaurant. He has ten employees and turns a good profit. He has plans to enlarge and improve the restaurant by taking on more employees and expanding the menu to attract more customers.

To help fund this project Naef has applied for a 500,000 YER loan through AMB. Among other things he needs to buy food supplies such as oil, sugar, flour, rice, chicken and many kinds of meats and vegetables for the new menu.

Naef’s goal for the future is to open a second restaurant. He wants to send his children to school and open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for his restaurant

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para invertirlo en la próxima temporada de siembra de granos básicos, comprara 12 qq de abono para el cultivo de 2 manzanas de maíz y pago de mozos, así seguirá teniendo su fuente de ingresos funcionando.
Manifiesta que con la ayuda del préstamo anterior ha tenido buena productividad, las condiciones de vida familiar han cambiado positivamente,  tienen  nuevas oportunidades de mejorar su negocio de agricultura y venta de pan artesanal.
texts.en:
Maria needs capital to invest in the next season of planting basic grains. She will buy 12 quintals (about 1200 lbs) of compost for her planting of 2 manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of corn and will pay for labor. Thus she will keep her source of income functioning.

She states that with the help of the previous loan, she had good productivity, the family living conditions have changed positively, and they have new opportunities to improve her businesses of agriculture and selling home-made bread.

loans.use: to buy 12 quintals of compost for her planting of 2 manzanas of corn and pay for labor to keep her source of income functioning.

loans.name: Vanmalar Shg - Viragalur Group

texts.en:
Ponmani (the featured borrower who is standing with her hand raised in the middle of the photo) and six of her friends, Esther Nesamani, Ruby Jayakumari, Vijaya, Sammanasumary, Josephinemary and Arockiyamary, have formed a group called ‘Vanmalar’. All hail from Viragalur village in Trichy in Tamil Nadu. Most of them are daily wage laborers and help supplement their household income. These diligent women are unable to save money from their monthly income. A major chunk of their income goes towards buying firewood or kerosene, and a lot of their time is spent cooking over traditional "chulha" stoves. These chulhas, apart from being time-consuming, also emit a lot of smoke, which plays havoc with their health. This adds to their medical expenses.
 
Hence, to tackle these problems, they have approached PAT (Micrograam’s field partner) to buy Greenway cook stoves. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are that: it leads to fuel savings, uses all solid fuels, minimizes emissions of CO, CO2, supports fast and convenient cooking, is highly durable, and is maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. Hence, they are seeking a group loan repayable in easy installments. They intend to use the loan to purchase Greenway cook stoves. Your loan will help these women to have better health and save a little more money.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Omsakthi Shg - Athanur Group

texts.en:
Mangalampal, 40 years old, is a leader of the OmSakthi Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Athanur village, Tanjore District, Tamil Nadu. Mangalampal lives in her own house with her two children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Mangalampal has been taking loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loans on time.    

According to the 2011 census, 70% of India still cooks on timber, animal dung and crop residues. The largest quality issue being that rural India still cooks on the mud stove, which is both inefficient and poses considerable health hazards due to the smoke and soot released, so Mangalampal wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs INR 1,400. It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone. (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.  

Mangalampal and the other member of the group are requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, vegetable farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and water her crops.
