Rosie wants to take full advantage of farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which she will use to buy vegetable and fruit seeds for her business. 

With your loan, Rosie will be able to expand her business. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Rosie is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Rosie dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy vegetable and fruit seeds for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Josephine has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Josephine aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cherryl works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. Cherryl is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Cherryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle for her new animal husbandry business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 31 years old and has seven children. She is married and has six children who are currently in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been in the pig fattening business for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old and married with five children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, milk, juice, coffee, shampoo, sanitary pads, beers, etc. to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, milk, juice, coffee, shampoo, sanitary pads, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is 51 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ponciana has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming coconut.

Ponciana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marikolunthu Shg - Nallur Group

texts.en:
Revathi is a 40-year-old woman who is married with two children. Revathi’s husband is a marginal farmer with an average income.

Revathi has learned of a smokeless stove manufactured by Grameen Infra that uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Most members in her community use conventional firewood stoves in their kitchens, which causes 70% more smoke emissions than the smokeless stove. Revathi wishes to be able to save money on fuel expenses as well as to provide a good atmosphere in the house, devoid of caustic fumes.

Revathi is a leader of the Marikolunthu Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in Nallur village in the Tanjore District in Tamil Nadu, India. She and the other 14 members of the group wish to request a group loan in order to buy this smokeless stove. They all are hoping to benefit from the lower fuel costs and safety of lower smoke emissions.    

This is Marikolunthu group’s very first loan from Kiva. The group members are very excited about the opportunity to purchase this sustainable stove and wish to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her business.

Rosario has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from food vending and raising ducks.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Leoniza works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Leoniza is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase fish to dry and sell in her dried fish-making business.

Leoniza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to dry and sell in her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carolina is 37 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Carolina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Carolina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Muthumariyamman-1 Shg - Ammasathiram Group

texts.en:
A group of nine women formed Muthumariyamman-1 Self-Help Group in Ammasathiram, a tiny village in Tanjore, Tamil Nadu. Most of their fellow villagers, including these nine women, work during the day as laborers in nearby industries and farms and some of them have their own livelihood. They make just enough money to return home in the evenings, feed themselves and be able to repeat the same thing all over again the next day. It is harder for the women, who also attend to the myriad domestic chores, such as cleaning and washing and cooking. Apart from the physical exertion, it is the lack of respite from the dust and smoke, at work and at home, that takes a toll and makes them susceptible to health hazards. Lung diseases are extremely common.     

PAT (Micrograam’s partner) works to address part of the problem. They promote clean, energy-efficient cooking stoves, so that, at least while cooking, the women’s exposure to soot and smoke is minimized. The stoves use dung, agro-waste, etc. as fuel and so, have low CO2 emissions. They are also very cheap to run and help save significant amounts of money. So, Bhuvaneshwari, the featured borrower, and her group have decided to buy these stoves. They are all married and most have young kids. They know it is imperative that they offer their kids as healthy a life as possible, so they can grow up and extricate their families from the poverty spiral they are trapped in. They do not have enough money to buy these stoves outright. They seek to borrow the requisite amount and repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto lives in Tumauini, which is located in the province of Isabela. His principal economic activity is agriculture; he grows rice. 

Modesto is a responsible and friendly person. At this time, he needs a loan to buy seeds. Modesto is grateful to the investors for the loan, and he promises to make his payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his agriculture business

loans.name: Jowayna

texts.en:
Jowayna is 34 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Jowayna has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Magdalena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Magdalena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sura

texts.en:
As a married parent with one child, Sura works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell peanuts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Sura is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional peanuts to sell for her buy and sell peanuts business.

Sura has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 56 years old and widowed with three children, one of whom is in school. Fortunata works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Fortunata has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 44 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Milagros has been farming bananas for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Muthumariyamman-2 Shg - Ammasathiram Group

texts.en:
Saranya, 27 years old, is a leader of the Muthumariyamman-2 Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Ammasathiram village, Tanjore District, Tamil Nadu. Saranya lives in her own house with her children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Saranya has been taking loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loan on time.   

According to the 2011 census, 70% of India still cooks on timber, animal dung and crop residues. The largest quality issue being that rural India still cooks on the mud stove, which is both inefficient and poses considerable health hazards due to the smoke and soot released, so Saranya wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs INR 1,400. It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone. (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from the indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.  

Saranya and the other members of the group are requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 44 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. She sells firewood in Kisumu town and has been in this business for 10 years now. Her spouse also works and he provides additional income. Right now, her monthly income is KES 9,000.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of firewood to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy a plot of land. 

This is her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to be successful and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school.

Yolanda earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
Junalyn is 30 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Junalyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Junalyn has been farming bananas for two years and earns additional income from raising chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives in Ermera and she is a businesswoman. Fatima is requesting a loan of $1,500 to improve her business and increase her income. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as water, shampoo, candles, detergent and other things to sell, including drinks and soft drinks. She first opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $1,000. 

Fatima is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, Fatima can improve her business management in the future.

loans.use: To buy water, shampoo, candles, detergent and other things to sell including drinks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Noribeth

texts.en: Noribeth is 33 years old and married with three children. She implemented her small shop in her home where she's lived for many years. The loan will be invested in buying more different kinds of soap that she sells. In her free time, she offers cleaning services. Noribeth dreams that someday she can build her own stall where she can display her products, so that her customers are comfortable buying her products.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of soap to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 50, is a small-holder farmer who resides in the Nyamira area of Kenya. The mother of four has been a farmer for 30 years. Her primary income sources are tea, pension and a side business.

Hellen finds farming to be very enjoyable. However, as she is aging, she is finding tea picking to be challenging. She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business since the demand for poultry products is always high.

With your loan, Hellen is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Hellen is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is widowed with three children, who all go to school. She also has additional family members. Teopista sells maize brand (leftovers of milled maize) and soya beans in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Teopista has applied for a loan of 2,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy maize brand and soya beans. She works at the milling grain centre seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation. 

Teopista aspires to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy maize brand (leftovers of milled maize) and bags of soya beans

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Adelaida has been engaged in making and selling soft brooms within the local community to supplement her husband's income.

She aims to make this business profitable in order to meet the necessities of her family but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, Adelaida would like to avail herself of financial assistance of PHP 15,000 to buy more rattan and tiger grass needed in making soft brooms to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more rattan and tiger grass needed in making soft brooms to sell

loans.name: Madhuraimeenakshi-2 Shg - Athiyur Group

texts.en:
Renuka leads the group “Madhuraimeenakshi-2” with four other women residing in the Athiyur village of Tanjore District in Tamil Nadu. They are all married, and to support their family income and meet their monthly expenditure, they have to work. They are hardworking women. For cooking, they mostly use the traditional chulhas, makeshift stoves that use firewood, which emit a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings. Renuka is the featured borrower. 

This five-member group is seeking a loan to purchase five Greenway cooking stoves. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. They intend to repay the loan amount in easy installments. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless cook stove

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, charcoal, eggs, soap, groceries, etc. 

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Marilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, charcoal, eggs, soap, and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Maxim

texts.ru:
Максим живет в Дрогобыче, Западная Украина. Он изготовляет изделия из дерева (малые архитектурные формы), декоративные деревянные и текстильные изделия, а также предоставляет услуги дизайна. Его работы пользуются большой популярностью в городе, так как конкурентов у него совсем нет. 
На сумму в 40 000 гривен Максим надеется сделать ремонт в собственном двухэтажном доме. На данном этапе он заканчивает внутренние работы. Собирается делать ремонт в цокольном помещении и на втором этаже, а именно ложить пол, шпаклевать стены и потолок и красить все. В трех комнатах планирует делать стяжку, а в двух остальных — хочет сделать монтаж гипсокартона на стену.
texts.en: Maxim lives in Drogobych in western Ukraine.  He's a craftsman by trade, making landscape decorations out of wood and cloth and offering his services as a designer as well.  His work is in high demand throughout Drogobych as he has no direct competitors.  He's seeking a loan of 40,000 hryvnia to renovate his two-story house; currently, he's finishing up work on the interior, and plans to start renovating his basement and the second floor of his house by laying down new flooring, caulking the walls and ceiling, and applying paint.  He also needs to lay down a concrete foundation for the floor in three rooms, and put in drywall in the other two.

loans.use: lay down new flooring and caulk and paint his walls and ceiling.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 45 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y ahora está felizmente acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los cuidados del hogar, viven solos pues no tienen hijos con ella, sin embargo Alexander tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que procreó con su primera pareja.


Alexander se dedica a realizar mediciones de terreno, en contratos por ingenieros civiles y arquitectos, a su profesión se le conoce popularmente como “cadeneros”. Esta actividad lleva realizándola desde que tenía 20 años de edad y gracias a la ayuda de Dios ha logrado desempeñarla de la mejor manera.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar cemento y cementar el piso de su casa, el cual es de tierra, él ya tiene  mucho de los materiales como lo son la piedra, el hierro, y la arena, solo le hace falta la compra del cemento.

Él sueña con tener una bonita y confortable vivienda donde pueda disfrutar al lado de su pareja y sus futuros hijos con ella.
texts.en:
Alexander is 45 years old. He studied up until high school and is now happily married; his wife is a homemaker. They live alone since he has no children with her, however Alexander has 2 adult children he fathered with his first wife.

Alexander is a ground surveyor; a contractor for civil engineers and architects, in his profession they are commonly known as "bouncers." He has been doing this since he was 20 years old, and thanks to the help of God he has done so in the best manner.

The requested loan is to buy cement and to cement the floor of his house, which is dirt. He already has much of the materials such as the stone, iron, and sand; he only needs to buy the cement.

He dreams of having a sweet and comfortable livelihood where he can relax alongside his wife and their future children.

loans.use: to buy cement and cement the floor of his house, which is a dirt floor.

loans.name: Lizet Johana

texts.es:
La juventud es una virtud que muchas personas desaprovechan pero lizet una joven emprendedora de 24 años de edad con hambre y ganas de un futuro prometedor se presenta hoy ante la comunidad kiva con el ánimo de solicitar ayuda para que la apoyen el proyecto de servicios de belleza básicamente salón de belleza para lo cual tomo clases durante dos años y hace un año trabaja al porcentaje en salas de belleza donde es llamada por sus buenos servicios.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de elementos para su spa de uñas, comprara barnice, una silla, Lavapiés, donde taller, los pies y muchos otros elementos para prestar un servicio innovador y eficaz. 
Este  negocio el permite colaborar a sus padres puede llevar alimento a su hogar y disfrutar todos los días de su progreso sueña con tener un salón de belleza pero es consciente que debe trabajar e ir forjando su sueño paso a paso y sabe que este crédito será un gran empuje para su vida.
texts.en:
Youth is a blessing that many people squander, but Lizet, age 24, is an eager and enterprising young woman who wants a brighter future.  She presents herself to the Kiva community today in order to request their help and support for her project, which is to open a beauty salon. 

She took classes for two years, and she has been working on a percentage basis in beauty salons for one year. They call on her because of her good service. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of items for her nail spa.  She will purchase nail polish, a chair, footbaths for pedicures, and many other items, in order to provide an innovative and efficient service. 

This business will allow her to help her parents, enable her to provide food for their home, and enjoy her progress every day. She dreams of having a beauty salon, but she knows that she must work and build her dream step by step. She knows that the loan will be a great help in her life.

loans.use: to purchase items for her nail spa, such as chairs, footbaths, nail polish, and manicure tools, in order to work towards opening her beauty salon.

loans.name: Rosa Ibeth

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cueles tienen 11, 7 y 3 años de edad; por la necesidad de tener ingresos para superar la su crisis económica Rosa fundo hace un tiempo una venta de tortillas en su vivienda, trabaja de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., sus ventajas son que atiende bien a sus clientes y se mantiene al pendiente de los cuidados de su familia. En este momento no representa dificultades.
Comprará maíz, cal, sodas, jugos, boquitas y dulces tendrá materia para elaborar la venta de tortillas y ofrecerá nuevos productos a sus clientes, la compra le será de ayuda para mejorar las ventas y las ganancias. Los riesgos son algunos problemas de salud de Rosa.
Sus sueños son ir ampliando su negocio para contar con su fuente de ingresos y salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and children, who are eleven, seven and three years old. With a need to earn an income in order to overcome financial problems, some time ago Rosa started a business selling tortillas at her home. She works from 7am until 5pm. The strength of Rosa's business is that she serves her customers well. The business allows Rosa to look after her family and she has no difficulties with it.

Rosa will buy maize, lime, fizzy drinks, fruit juices, snack and sweets; Rosa will then have the supplies to make and sell tortillas and to offer her customers new products. Rosa's purchases will be a great help to improve sales and increase profits. One risk that the business is facing is that Rosa has some health problems.

Rosa's dreams are to expand the business in order to be able to count on her source of income and to progress with her children.

loans.use: to buy maize, lime, fizzy drinks, fruit juices, snack and sweets; Rosa will then have the supplies to make and sell tortillas and to offer her customers new products.

loans.name: Ana Delfina

texts.es:
Ana de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, tiene una hija a quien ella crió sola y que ahora vive en USA.

Ana se dedica a la venta de panes los días domingos cuando el equipo de futbol de la comunidad juega en la cancha con otros equipos.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar cemento y arena y hacer un andén alrededor de su casa, ya que cuando llueve se mete el agua en su vivienda y más ahora que ha llegado el invierno.

Ella espera dejar un patrimonio a su hija para cuando regrese a su país.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old, hard-working and managed to complete high school. She has a daughter whom she raised alone, and who now lives in the US.

Ana makes a living selling bread on Sundays when the community football team plays other teams at the local pitch.

She needs this loan in order to buy cement and sand and to make a path around her house as when it rains water comes into her home; this will be worse now that winter has come.

Ana hopes to leave her daughter an inheritance for when she returns to her home country.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and make a path a path around her house.

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirian, comercializa pan, frutas y verduras, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, todos viven juntos y aportan para subsistir; su actividad económica la desempeña desde hace nueve años, lo aprendió en su familia con su mamá, la venta de pan la elaboro ciertos días de la semana y en algunas ocasiones lo compra para revender, su horaria es de una de la tarde a cinco de la tarde, la ventaja es que ofrece a sus clientes productos de calidad.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar harinas, levaduras, leña, azúcar, colorantes y otros materiales necesarios para la elaboración de pan, espera cubrir la demanda de los clientes, pues en ocasiones  no logra cumplir con todos los pedidos, con dicha inversión tendrá mayores ventas e ingresos para cubrir todas sus obligaciones.
Mirian sueña con diversificar más su negocio, tener estabilidad económica que le permita tener alimentación, vestuario y acceso a salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian sells bread, fruits and vegetables. She is married and has six children. The family all lives together and everyone brings in an income to survive. Mirian has been practising her trade for nine years, having learned it from her mother. Mirian makes bread some days every week and, on occasion, buys it to re-sell. Mirian works from 1pm until 5pm. The advantage to customers is that Mirian sells good quality products.

Mirian will use this loan in order to buy flour, yeast, firewood, sugar, artificial colouring and other necessary supplies for making bread. She hopes to cover customer demand as, sometimes, she cannot fulfill all orders. With this investment, Mirian will have a higher sales and a higher income in order to cover necessary costs at home.

Mirian dreams of diversifying her business, of having financial stability that allows her always to buy food, clothes and healthcare for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, firewood, sugar, artificial colouring and other necessary supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián un hombre con sueños e ilusiones que encontró en el diseño su vocación y pasión, trabaja en una empresa pero se sentía vació vio que no podía proyectarse más y desde ese entonces opto por volverse independiente y enfrentar el duro mercado, sus diseños han tenido buena acogida, cada día le piden más prendas pero al ser solo diseñador no cuenta con una taller de confección y por lo pronto manda a realizar sus prendas en talleres que realizan confección a terceros. 
Tiene un buen pedido pero como esta en montaje de su empresa no cuenta con buen capital por tal razón quiere solicitar un crédito para tener capital de trabajo el cual invertirá en el pago a las confeccionistas y poder abarcar todo el pedido y darles una buena atención y rotación a los cliente. 
El crédito le permita seguir proyectándose y le asegurara buenos ingresos con los que consolidara y le dar más forma a la empresa pensando en contratar personal y viendo un futuro muy prometedor en 5 años. 

Si necesitan una r5azon de pro que invertir en esta persona es quizás pro que estarían apoyando a persona que quieren salir adelante que no tiene un pensamiento mediocre de conformarse con lo que tiene que es posible aspirar a más si solo lo desean este clientes es un claro ejemplo de una persona que con ambición y trabajo puede alcanzar grandes logros solo necesita tu apoyo para crecer.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a man with dreams that he has found in his vocation. He used to work for a business but felt empty and saw that he could not use his own initiative more. He therefore decided to become independent and face the difficult market alone. Sebastián's designs have been well received. Each day he receives more orders but, as just a designer, he does not have a dressmaking workshop. As a result he outsources production.

Sebastián has a big order but, as he is just starting up his business, he does not have capital. He is, as a result, applying for a loan in order to have capital to pay dressmakers and fulfill all the order. He wants to give customers good service and a quick turnaround time.

This loan will allow Sebastián to continue working and will guarantee a good income in order to consolidate and establish his business. He can then think about hiring staff and, in five years, have a more promising future.

If you need a reason for investing in Sebastián perhaps it is the following: you would be supporting somebody who wants to get ahead. He does not want to settle for what he has. He can aspire to more if his customers let him. Sebastián is a clear example of somebody who, with ambition and hard work, can achieve great things. He just needs your support in order to grow.

loans.use: to buy dressmakers for their clothing items as Sebastian is a designer who chooses to outsource production and is building up his business little by little.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Hello! Meet Angela, a 45-year-old caring, loving, and adorable mother of seven children. She resides in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Due to lack of funds, Angela never got an opportunity to further her education so that she could get a white-collar job, but that did not kill her dream of succeeding in life. She  has been farming for the last 24 years on a small piece of land. Angela enjoys working on her farm so much and has always been able to put food on the table for her family. Through practicing mixed farming (that is, crop and animal farming) she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Angela enjoys dairy farming a lot and has even nicknamed her cow “Fraser.” This means that the cow produces a lot of milk. Angela is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase farm implements and also increase the poultry on her farm. There has been an increase in egg consumption in her area and the supply has always been low. This is why Angela wants to take advantage of that and make good profits by selling more eggs and poultry products. Angela will also use the farm implements to increase her crop production levels. Products such as fertilizers will be used to improve the production output. It can be said with confidence that if you invest in Angela, you are investing in someone who will want to transform her life and also transform the lives of those in society. In the next year, Angela is projecting that she will have more poultry and be able to meet the demand in her area. Through the profits gathered, Angela can comfortably pay off the loan and invest the other profits in her children's education. Angela hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements and additional poultry

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 52-year-old widow with three children.  With one child still in school, Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, shampoo, cereals, coffee, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, cereals, coffee, biscuits, milk, soft drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas is a 29-year-old  married man with a 3-year-old child. He operates a general store selling sugar, beer, soda and cooking oil, among other items. He faces a challenge of limited capital; however, he hopes to expand his business. He needs a loan to buy soda, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: to buy soda, soap and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Ndiarka's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été créé le 26 décembre 2011.le groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toutes du commerce.Diarka est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgé de 59 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 filles. Elle fait du commerce et a une expérience de plus de 20 ans.Elle expose au quais de pêche et vend de la qualité, ce qui fait sa force. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter du poisson frais, et fumé. ses bénéfice lui permettent d'épargner dans le Banc villageois,de cotiser pour ses tontines et aider aussi son mari dans les charges de la maison.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was established on December 26, 2011. The group is made up of five women who are all merchants and live in the same neighborhood.

Diarka, age 59, is the group's representative. She's married and the mother of five children, including four girls. She's a merchant with more than 20 years of experience in the field.

She displays her products at fishing wharfs and sells quality products, which is her strength. With this loan, she intends to buy fresh and smoked fish. Her profits enable her to put money away at the Banc Villageois, pay contributions to her tontines, and also help her husband cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fresh and smoked fish

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été créé le 26 décembre 2011. le groupe est composé de neuf femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui font toute du commerce. Yacine la représentante du groupe; est marié et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons.Elle fait du commerce de poissons séchés et fumés et a une expérience de 10 ans, et maitrise bien son domaine.Elle achète le poison frais et paie les transformateurs pour le séchage. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des sacs de sel, de l'herbe sec, des caisses de poissons et payer les gens qui font le travail de séchage.Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille; et de réfectionner sa maison.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was established on December 26, 2011. The group is made up of nine women who are merchants and live in the same neighborhood.

Yacine is the group's representative. She's married and the mother of seven children, including four boys. She sells dried and smoked fish, and masters this field since she has ten years of experience.

She buys fresh fish and pays to have it dried. With her loan, she intends to buy sacks of salt, dried herbs, crates of fish, and pay people who dry fish.

Her profits enable her to take care of her family and repair her home.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of salt, dried herbs, and 30 crates of fish

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Sabougnouma est constitué de quatre femmes  tous mariées équitablement et vie dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djélibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier des liens de voisinages et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de condiments, des  légumes  et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  il y a de cela un mois et sont à leur 3ème   cycle en prêt solidaire.
Madame Moussokoro (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (tomates…). Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  14 corbeilles de tomates. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à Djélibougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Moussokoro compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma Group is made up of four married woman who live equitably in polygamous and monogamous households. They average 45 years of age and six children each. 

They live in Djélibougou, a neighborhood in Bamako. They got to know each other through tontines in the neighborhood and their money-earning businesses.

The members of the groups are merchants, who sell products such as condiments, vegetables, and charcoal. Eager to bolster their working capital, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Moussokoro is the second woman from the right in the photograph. She is very renowned as a condiments (tomatoes) saleswoman. She intends to use this loan to buy 14 baskets of tomatoes. 

The members of the group get their supplies in Médine, and sell for cash in Djélibougou, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

With this loan, Mrs. Moussokoro intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 90'000, to be used to cover her children's daily expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to reach her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy 14 baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction supplies (cement, rebars, nails, etc)

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 23 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries. Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, watering equipment and materials for preparing his land and crops.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 25-year-old single man living with his family in their own house. He is an educated man with a university education. Due to high rates of  unemployment in the country, Maher cannot find a job to look after his family. He is unemployed, but he does not surrender to that condition. He strives to find a job to improve the condition of his family. He is a very dynamic and vigorous young man. Maher lives with his family in a small, old house. It needs to be renovated and expanded. Maher's father is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to renovate the house. Maher decided to help his father with the renovation. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase construction materials to renovate and expand the house to make it more comfortable and spacious.

Maher looks forward to opening his own business in order to provide his family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate and expand the family's house to make it more comfortable and spacious.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 56 years old and is married with four children. All of them go to school. She has been farming for 20 years, She will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

She is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP so that she will have additional income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production.

loans.name: Nogaye's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois a été créé le 26 décembre 2011.Le groupe est composé de 9 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui ont comme activité principale le commerce. Nogaye est la représentante du groupe, elle a 80 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de poisson fumé et séché. Elle engage des gens qui font la transformation du poisson frais. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des caisses de poissons, du sel, de l'herbe sèche, payer la main d’œuvre et les frais de transport. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'aider ses enfants, et acheter des moutons pour faire de l'embouche.
texts.en:
The 'Banc Villageois' was created on 26th December 2011, and is made up of nine women who live in the same neighbourhood, and all work in commerce.

Nogaye is the group representative.  She is 80 years old, married and has seven children.  She employs people to process fresh fish and then she sells the smoked and dried fish.

Nogaye plans to use her loan to buy 40 boxes of fish for 200,000 francs CFA, salt for 20,000 francs CFA, dried herbs for 25,000 francs CFA, pay labour costs and pay transport costs.  Her profits will be used to help her children and buy sheep for rearing.

loans.use: to buy 40 boxes of fish, salt and herbs for her fish business.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Siguidia sont équitablement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 50 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente de,  légumes (bananes plantains et avocats), restauration et condiments. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  4ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car les légumes sont très prises par les femmes à Djélibougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de bananes plantains et 8 corbeilles d’avocats. Elles s’approvisionnent à Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Djélibougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Siguidia Group is made up of four women who are married and live either in monogamous or polygamous households.  They are, on average, 50 years old and have five children.  All the women live in one of the neighbourhoods of Bamako.  They know one another through savings groups and through their work.  Each group member has a different business, selling vegetables (banana plantains and avocadoes), running restaurants and selling food ingredients.

In order to increase and expand their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth group loan.

Mariam (sitting on the far right in the photo) has a good reputation among the women who buy vegetables in Djélibougou.  She plans to use her loan to buy ten sacks of banana plantains and eight baskets of avocadoes, from Médine.  She will then sell her produce to women in Djélibougou, for cash.

Mariam expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be used to meet her needs and reinvest in her business.  Mariam intends to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to take advantage of their loan system.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Sinignèsigui sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djélibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier des liens de voisinages et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’oignons, des poissons, artisanaux  et habits. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  4ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété, car  les oignons sont  très prisé par les femmes à Djélibougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  15 sacs d’oignons en gros. Elles s’approvisionnent à  Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Djélibougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 50 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Sinignèsigui Group is made up of four women who are married and live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 50 years old and have four children.  All the women live in Djélibougou, one of the neighbourhoods of Bamako.  They know one another through savings groups, neighbourhood connections and through their work.  Each group member has a different business, selling onions, fish, clothing and hand-made products.

In order to increase and expand their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth group loan.

Maïmouna (sitting on the far left in the photo) has a good reputation among the women who buy onions in Djélibougou.  She plans to use her loan to buy fifteen sacks of onions from wholesalers in Médine.  She will then sell her onions to women in Djélibougou, for cash.

Maïmouna expects to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be used to meet her needs and reinvest in her business.  Maïmouna intends to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to take advantage of their loan system.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients (onions) for resale.

loans.name: Zoraya Yosedin

texts.es:
Zoraya, tiene una sala de belleza, es casada, solamente vive con su esposo ya que por el momento no tiene hijos; su negocio lo atiende sola de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, lo aprendió mediante cursos, hasta la fecha lo ha administrado bien.
El capital que requiere será de utilidad para comprar tintes, esmaltes, tijeras, cosméticos, etc., el resto servirá para remodelar el local, mejorara su inventario y la imagen del negocio, espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y recuperar lo invertido con mejores ganancias.
Sus proyectos son mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio para pagar sus deudas y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Zoraya is married and lives alone with her husband because they don't yet have children. She has a beauty salon, where she works alone from eight in the morning until four in the afternoon. She learned the trade by doing courses and up until now she's been running her business well. 

The capital she requires will be useful to buy dyes, nail varnishes, scissors, cosmetics, etc. The rest will be used to redesign her premises, increase her inventory and improve her business' image. She hopes to offer her customers a better service and make a return on investments with increased earnings. Her projects are to increase her business' profits so she can pay off her debts and work with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail varnish, scissors, cosmetics, etc. The rest will be used to redesign her premises, increase her inventory and improve her business' image.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, ha mantenido en buen estado el molino nixtamal con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, ha mejorado su situación económica por lo que le ha facilitado cancelar su deuda y ampliar su negocio haciendo la apertura de una tienda para atraer a nuevos clientes y tener mejores ingresos. 
En está ocasión don Rafael se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar repuestos para el molino, aceite, granos básicos, bebidas y otros productos que le ayuden a tener su negocio en el mercado y seguir generando más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rafael has kept the nixtamal (treated corn) mill with the help of a previous loan. He has improved his economical situation, which has made it easier to cancel his debt, and expanded his business by opening a store that will attract new clients and lead to better earnings. 

This time, Don Rafael is requesting a new loan to purchase spare parts for his mill, oil, dry grains, drinks, and other products that will help him keep his market stall and continue to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the mill, oil, dry grains, drinks, and other products that will help him keep his market stall and continue to generate income.

loans.name: Asucena Maribel

texts.es:
Azucena es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y ahora está felizmente acompañada, su pareja se dedica a darle el mantenimiento de fontanería al proyecto de agua de la comunidad, tiene un hijo de 4 años que depende de ella.

Azucena se dedica a la elaboración de panes con pollo, los cuales vende los días domingos cuando el equipo de futbol de la comunidad llega a jugar, por el momento el negocio le ha funcionado y espera seguir creciendo.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar cemento y terminar de construir las paredes de la casa donde viven, ya que están hechas de bahareque y piensa reforzarlas con cemento, y también para cementar el piso que es de tierra.

Ella sueña con tener una linda casa, donde pueda ver crecer a sus hijos de forma confortable y tener un negocio próspero con el cual poder gozar de una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Azucena is a young 25-year old woman. She studied up until her Bachelor's, and she is now happily married. Her partner makes his living doing maintenance for the plumbing and water in their community. They have one son who is 4 years old.

Azucena makes a living making bread with chicken, which she sells on Sundays when the football team plays. At the moment, her business is functioning, and she hopes it will continue to grow. 

She is asking for a loan to buy cement to finish building the walls at her home, which are made of mud and need cement to be reinforced, and also to cement the ground floor.

She dreams of having a beautiful home, where she is able to watch her children grow up comfortably, and also to have a prospering business with which she is able to enjoy a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, to finish constructing the walls at her home, and to cement the ground floor.

loans.name: Calixto Fortunato

texts.es:
Calixto es un hombre de 65 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la producción y venta de queso artesanal.
Él es emprendedor, Inteligente, generoso, comprensivo, paciente, buen oyente, solidario, Fuerte, luchador, Alegre, optimista, feliz, responsable y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la población de ‘Belen Yayes’ que se caracteriza por el puente prehispánico que vincula a esta población con la población de Cumaná y se ubica a 17 kilómetros de la población de Puerto Pérez, atraviesa el lago menor o Wiñay Marka del Lago Titicaca, con una extensión de aproximadamente 520 metros de largo y un ancho de cuatro metros y construida en base a piedra y terraplén de tierra, presumiblemente formó parte de la época de expansión de la cultura Tiahuanaco, en su recorrido se puede observar la vegetación acuática con grandes extensiones de totorales, en ellos habitan una variedad de especies nativas, entre peces, anfibios y aves destacándose la "Choca" o pato del lago, los zambullidores (rodellia micróptera) y las "Huallatas". 
Calixto es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana su lengua nativa es el aymara y utiliza muy poco el español. Su trabajo es la producción y venta de queso artesanal. Él comienza con la extracción de la leche de su propio ganado y posteriormente la homogeneizará, de esta manera le dá el color blanco característico de la leche, la vierte en cubas donde le añade fermentos lácticos e Inmediatamente la leche se cuaja.
Él sueña en mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar los ingresos económicos para su familia, el clima del lugar no le ayuda porque existen heladas y sequías que afectan la producción lechera.
Es por esos motivos que Calixto solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Calixto is a 65 year old man. He is single and has no children. His business is producing and selling artisanal cheese. He is an entrepreneur who is intelligent, generous, understanding, a good listener, supportive, strong, a fighter, cheerful, optimist, happy, responsible and very hardworking. He does his work in the town of ‘Belen Yayes’. It has a pre-colonial bridge that connects this town to the town of Cumaná and is located 17 kilometers from the town of  Puerto Pérez. The bridge is by the smaller lake, or Wiñay Marka, of lake Titicaca, and extends 520 meters long and 4 meters wide, with a stone base and supported by earth. Presumably, it was a part of the expansion of the Tiahuanaco culture. Over its expanse aquatic vegetation can be seen where a variety of native species live, including fish, amphibians and birds. Some of the notable ones are the "Choca" or lake duck, the loons (rollandia microptera) and the "Huallatas". 

Calixto has dark skin, short black hair, and medium height. His native tongue is Aymara and he uses very little Spanish. His work is producing and selling artisanal cheese. He starts by extracting milk from his own cattle and later homogenizing it. This gives the milk its characteristic white color. He pours it into buckets where he adds lactic ferments and immediately the milk curdles. 

He dreams of improving his family's quality of life and income. The local weather doesn't help because there are frosts and droughts that affect the milk production. That is why Calixto is asking for a loan to buy dairy cattle and with the profits he will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle and with the profits improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara abono, para dar un buen trato al cultivo de granos básicos y mantener la continuidad de su negocio, espera obtener una mayor productividad y granos de calidad.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha tenido granos básicos para consumo familiar y para abastecer a sus clientes, cuenta con ingresos con los que cubre las principales necesidades de su familia y cancela la deuda obtenida.
texts.en:
Juan has decided to ask for a new loan, with which he will buy fertilizer to use in the cultivation of basic grains in order to maintain and continue his business. He hopes to obtain a higher production and quality grains.

With the previous loan, he was able to buy basic grains for his own household consumption, and to supply his customers. He hopes his income will cover the basic needs of his family and cancel out his debt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use in the cultivation of basic grains in order to maintain and continue his business.

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
Bernabé de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad.
Bernabé emigró hacia USA y vivió un tiempo allá, luego regresó y pudo construir su propia casa en su país natal, en la cual habita con su esposa e hijos.

Bernabé es albañil, oficio que aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre, quien le enseñó las bases de la albañilería, él trabaja por contrato en las ciudades más cercanas a su comunidad.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para construir un garaje para el carro, puesto que se aproxima el invierno y necesita proteger su vehículo de la lluvia. 

Bernabé sueña con seguir mejorando su vivienda para dejar una buena herencia para sus hijos y así que puedan gozar de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bernabe is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult-aged children. He studied until his Bachelor's. Bernabe emigrated to the USA and lived for some time there, later returning to build his own home in his home country where his wife and children could live.

Bernabe is a stonemason, which he learned about when he was very young from his father, who taught him the basics of masonry. He works on contract in the cities surrounding his community.

The loan he is requesting is needed to build a garage for his car because winter is approaching and he needs to protect his car from the rain.

Bernabe dreams of continuing to better his home in order to leave a good legacy for his children so that they can enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to build a garage for his car because winter is approaching and he needs to protect his car from the rain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three blenders, 3 work tables, inventory, a cooler and she will make some adjustments for the business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 51 years old, widowed and has 5 children. She has a grocery business in Kisumu town. She sells vegetables, tomatoes and onions. She has been in this business for 8 years now and she makes a monthly income of 3,000 KES.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of groceries to sell in her business. These include vegetables, onions and tomatoes. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future Judith hopes to educate her children and also expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Diana es una confeccionista que particularmente trabaja a terceros empresas que la contratan para adecuar algún corte, no conforme con esta situación, aspirando y proyectando su vida y básicamente por gusto quiere iniciar con una línea propia un proyecto que tenía hace años pero pro al falta de capital nunca lo pudo ejecutar.
Ahora que se le presenta esta oportunidad de poder solicitar un crédito se siente muy motivada pues siente que sueño cada vez lo ve más cerca, solicita un crédito para la compra de tela con la que iniciara su línea propia de ropa y con la ayuda de sus clientes que la adentraran en el mercado espera tener un gran éxito y tener trabajo constante todo el año. 
Su gran sonrisa refleja el entusiasmo, ganas, ansiedad de esperar este crédito por lo que pide cooperación y se compromete a pagar las cuotas muy puntuales pues estarán cumpliendo su sueño de tener su línea propia.
texts.en:
Diana is a seamstress who in particular works for third parties, businesses that hire her to alter some design. Not satisfied with this situation, and with aspirations and projects for her life and basically because she wants to, she wants to start a project with her own line.

Now she is presented with this opportunity of a loan. She feels very motivated and can see that her dream is coming closer. She is asking for a loan to buy fabric with which she will start her own line of clothing. With the help of of her customers, who will introduce her into the market, she hopes to have a lot of success and have constant work all year long. 
 
Her big smile reflects her enthusiasm, willingness and eagerness for this loan. She is asking for your cooperation and is committed to making her payments on time, because she will be achieving her dream of having her own line.

loans.use: to buy fabric to start her dream of her own line of clothing. She hopes to have constant work all year.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora has a live-in partner woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 38 years old, and has two children who are in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc. for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc. for her business

loans.name: Magona Group

texts.en:
Mwahija, in her late 30's, is single and has got one kid who is in kindergarten. She runs a business of genge, selling fruits and vegetables, a project she has been in for six years. She is also runs another business, a charcoal store, a business Mwahija declared to be good. Mwahija normally services her genge with new stock every two days; this helps to attract more new customers. She works from 08 am to 06 pm daily, and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to specifically improve her genge project. The loan will be apportioned among Magona, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She will invest her loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her genge. Mwahija desires to manage a big and classic genge project.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her genge.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low returns. 

Mourine will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to open other branches within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Betty has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 31 years old, married, and blessed with only one child. She engages in buying and selling vegetables within the local community to generate income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to make her business profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more stock of tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, beans, onions and more leafy vegetables to sell. 

Having this financial assistance, Mely believes that someday she will further improve her business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages, beans, onions and more leafy vegetables

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 49 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like biscuits, canned goods, cereals, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years, and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned goods, cereals, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries. 

Emma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like biscuits, canned goods, cereals, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 27 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Joylyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Joylyn has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Joylyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the finances of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jocklyna

texts.en:
Jocklyna is 34 years old and married with children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jocklyna is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Jocklyna has been farming rice for two years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lisley

texts.en:
Lisley is 44 years old and has six children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Lisley is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her business.

She has been raising cattle for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lisley would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sinforiana

texts.en:
Sinforiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

Sinforiana has been in this business for 11 years. Sinforiana earns more income from food vending.

Sinforiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza is a hardworking woman. She is 30-years-old. Gulnoza lives with her husband and her child. She has one child. Fifteen years ago Gulnoza began her own business deal with buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Gulnoza sells vegetables and fruits in a store which is located in the central market. Gulnoza little by little developed her business. Now, she has regular customers because people every day buy and eat fresh fruits and vegetables. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fruits and vegetables. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Beatrice, a very hardworking mother who is 30 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Kanyekiini, a remote village in the fertile Kerugoya area of Kenya. This charming mother of two has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 2 years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, milk, tea, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kerugoya. Beatrice has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry. 

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Beatrice will achieve their dreams and goals. Beatrice believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Roberth Alberto

texts.es: Roberth Alberto, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de maíz  y algunos fertilizantes que requiere para aplicar en el momento de la siembra y días después cuando el cultivo tenga un tamaño adecuado,  además de pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno como lo son canales a nivel para evitar la erosión del suelo por la lluvia, con la realización de estas labores culturales espera tener un cultivo con un buen desarrollo y de antemano una cosecha adecuada. Con esta compra de productos adecuados tendrá una calidad mejor de producto para el consumidor. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roberth Alberto is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents and brothers, who are his biggest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy corn seeds and some fertilizers he needs to use at harvest time and some days later when the crops are the right size. In addition, he will pay labor to undertake work to prepare the land, like making horizontal channels to avoid soil erosion due to rain. By undertaking this work he hopes to produce a well-developed crop and a good harvest beforehand. As a result of buying the right products, he will have a better quality product to offer the customer. It's the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never received a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 56-year-old married man with five children. His oldest child is 24-years-old and the youngest one is 10 years, who live with him in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He has a pension salary. In reality, that salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of his family. Abdullah decided to seek another income source besides his small salary to provide his family with a better future. 

To do this thing, Abdullah decided to purchase an amount of phone cards, recharge and resale them door to door. Because he is an old man, he believes this humble business will be very suitable for him. Unfortunately, Abdullah doesn't have enough money to do that and his pension salary also is not enough. As a result, Abdullah applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase an amount of phone cards, recharge and resale for the people door to door to make a better future for his family.

Abdullah looks forward to increasing his business more through opening a call center that will help him in improve the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase an amount of phones cards, recharge and resale them

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en: Leoncio is 52 years old and only studied up to the 6th grade. His partner dedicates herself to household tasks. He has one child who lives with him. He has been engaged in the farming business for 15 years, all he wants for his life is to see his family have a good condition. Leoncio is asking for a loan amounting to Php 20,000 to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 40-year-old man who is married. They are blessed with four children. Richard has been working as a farmer for five years in his village. He is a very loving and dedicated person; he makes sure that he can provide all the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan amounting to Php 35,000 to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his business. In the future, Richard hopes that he can expand his business so that he can provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita  lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has managed a general store for over fifteen years, and she earns well to make a living. She was determined in running her business and was able to repay her previous loans used for the business successfully. She has been an active member of GDMPC since 2008. She took a new loan recently to purchase more variety of grocery goods to sell. Clarita is hopeful enough of earning more profit with her additional investment. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business, as well the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en: Zablon is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area good for business, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finance. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an expanded workshop. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of timber.

loans.name: Velinda

texts.en:
Velinda is 40 years old and has three children. Velinda is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Velinda is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Velinda requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Velinda has been raising cattle for five years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Velinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Renato
